1153111.content: Another question, are you following the orca or a human? Or maybe even some other animal?
1153111.title: Orca

choices: More scenarios by the pod load please
115313.content:
Straight to the scenarios

Infinite krill infinite growth: Some sort baleen whale comes across wishing coral. It wishes for unlimited amounts of krill to want to be eaten by it. An krill is created that can replicate itself infinitely, which will be need as the whales appetite is also infinite.

The Blue Whales' big secret: you are marine biologist and you have followed blue whales to the depth to learn what they do there. You learn that all blue whales can change size at will. This is secret whale business and cannot be known by humans, you must either have your memories of it erased or you must become a blue whale.
115313.title: Baleen Whale

choices: Walsy get so hungry even his heart doesn't work
1153131.content:
Walsy was very hungry. After befriending a krill that had swum into his left ear hole she resolved to never eat any krill again, or anything else that doesn't want to be eaten. The result of this is that she hadn't ate anything of the last year and half. Now you could see her bones, which meant most of her blubber was gone so she was also very cold. Now the whale was digesting it own muscles. Ever day she became weaker. Every rise to the surface to breathe was harder then the last.

Now as last she couldn't make it at all. She had taken her last breath. She had 30 minutes left. Enough time to say goodbye.

"Looks like its finally over, its for the best. Now I can apologise to all those millions of ghosts I made," Proclaimed Walsy Solemnly

"You don't have one more breath in you, just one more, please, Just. One. More," begged the krill, who never thought it needed a name, all the deaths would just hurt more if they had names.

"Nope, these flippers don't move at all now. I'm going to die, now, but dying with your best friend, pretty good as deaths go," denied Walsy sorrowfully.

As they said their last words to each other (words far to private for me to write here) the Walsy the whale sank to the ocean floor.

…

Previously

1 year after the resolution Walsy had become a legend of amongst krill and many other sea creatures. Now a swarm of krill approach, something they would never ever do before, because they'd get eaten. They get up with the krill in the ear. The krill explained about the resolution the whale had made, and the huge cost it was clearly having.

They decided to look for a way for the whale to eat without killing anyone. They would contact would spread the world so all the krill in all the oceans, as well as lakes and rivers. This there are krill everywhere they'll be able to look everywhere, and quickly too.

That was 6 months ago, the krill had been working hard to keep the whale alive for that time. Without its support it would have given up a long time ago.

…

Approaching Walsy was the largest krill shoal the world had ever seen. Walsy had earnt such bemused respect amongst other whales that they decided to leave it alone, at least until Walsy received his message, they all knew it would be Walsy's last day.

"We've done" they all cried out as once "we've found a way."

They quickly found the ear krill.

"It's too late, she can't go up to breath any more, she can't even talk anymore," decried the ear krill.

"That why there's so any of us," said several krill at once.

The krill then formed a cylinder just below the way. The first row of the cylinder smashed into the whale, slowing it descent a tiny amount The next hit, slowing it more. The next and the next and the next. The descent stopped. More then more rows of krill hit, the whale started to go up. It each hit it went up faster then faster

Breach.

The whale breathed very shallowly. Deadly carbon dioxide left and life sustaining oxygen flowed in.

The whales eyes opened.

"I guess I'm alive somehow. There's no way your going to hell," deduced Walsy.

"It turns out you have a lot of friends. They've found a way you can live without killing anybody," explained the ear kill, it then asked the other krill "so what is it."

"We'll found a wishing coral, it in the great barrier reef, it far more power then the other wishing corals, some say it is infinitely powerful, But it only grants completely unselfish wishes by the most moral of creatures.

"That's thousands of miles away and I can't swim at all," cautioned Walsy

"We'll swim for you," replied all the krill at once (yes they had planned this, there no krill hive mind here)

"If you all want to help a mass murderer then I certainly don't have the moral authority to say no," conceded the whale.

The set off. As they went along thousands of sea creatures helped push, and nobody ate anybody else. Various sea mammal snuggled up get to Walsy to keep him warm and seas spiders made him a sweater in many many pieces.

Now ever even with all the help they got they still came across a problem on the way.
1153131.title: Big wish needed for big hearted whale

choices: What do they mean by "if" you return to the surface (learn about transformation)
You ask to be shown more sizeshifting (mainly growth)
1153132.content:
For a long as you remember you have loved whale. Especially Baleen Whales, most especially Blue. You have tried to find out everything that you can about them There is one big mystery left, what you they do when they dive. You tried to send remotes to find out, but you always lost them, or the remote broke or something happened. Your only option is to go down there yourself.

The last probe didn't have it camera work, but the Locator and the microphone did. You new there were whales there but you put did she want they were doing. You dived.

You reached several miles beneath the surface. You but on powerful ultraviolent light (you wouldn't want to blind anything down here). The special glass in the portholes made light a visible kind. It has a very powerful light indeed, you could see as clear as you could on the continental shelf.

You saw a blue whale, it was huge. Well of course it was huge, it was blue whale, that their thing. But it wasn't just regular blue whale huge, it was 500ft long.

This didn't make sense, living things shouldn't get that big. You drove closer to check your measurements. You checked again with sonar and everything else you had handy. You made a mistake, it was bigger then that.

550 feet. You looked at it, it was visibly growing. 600feet was reached then 700, 1000 feet followed soon after. You so mesmerised you don't even notice it growing closer.

Boop!

The whale hits you, the impact your have destroyed you sub and killed you but instead there was no damage.

The whale eyes open.

It swims open and eyes you sub with and eye bigger than it.

Even though it could crush you with a particularly fast blink you feel completely safe.

"Human! Your species isn't ready to do this deep yet, you won't be ready to around 2247," the voice whilst load is nowhere near the volume of even an unenlarged blue whale, also you note its mouth didn't move. "You wonder how I am speaking, I am directly stimulating the auditory centres of you brain. All Baleen whales can do that and a lot of the toothed ones. You may not and cannot tell other humans of what you saw and heard here, your society isn't ready yet."

You think of protesting that but quickly decided the whale is right. Your sure people would do all sort of dumb stuff it they found out.

"If you ever return to surface all your memories of this will have to be erased, again. However you have tried many time to aid our kind, even if that aid was unnecessary. Therefore you may ask whatever questions you want."

You have many questions. Many have been haunting you your entire life, some have are inspired by what you've just seen.
1153132.title: The Blue Whales' Big Secret

11532.content:
Original author: Infinity421

What about a deer?
11532.title: Other

115321.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Alright, are you a deer or a human?
115321.title: A deer

1153211.content:
Original author: Infinity421

So, are we dealing with a wild deer, or one that is more tame?
1153211.title: Human

11532111.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You sit in the small clearing, enjoying nature as much as you can. You had always found forests relaxing and calming, but the feeling seemed... Heightened, somehow. Brown leaves lazily drift off the trees and onto the ground as you smile, content for now. You hear a faint rustling some distance behind you, and turn to look at the source.

Around twenty or so feet from you was a smallish deer, calmly regarding you as it stood in between two trees. You couldn't help but look it over quickly, the soft brown pelt peppered with a multitude of white spots that gradually faded to a completely white underbelly. Knowing deer could be dangerous no matter the gender, you slowly rise to your feet, preparing to back away, when the deer takes a slow, cautious step towards you.

What gender is the deer?
11532111.title: Wild deer

choices: Grows a bit and talks to you
115321111.content:
Judging by the impressive set of antlers on the deer, you assumed the deer was a male. You watch the stag as it casually approaches you, its eyes lined with curiosity. As much as you loved observing animals in their environment, you definitely prefer it when they're at a safe distance from you and didn't pose a threat to you. You start to back up when you realized the deer is much closer than you thought. Eventually your back bumps into a tree and you freeze as the deer gets closer. Your eyes dart up to its curved antlers, the dim forest light reflecting off the velvety surface. Impressive as they were, the fact that they natural weapons for fighting other males made you uneasy when you thought about what they could do to you.

The deer reaches you. With your back against the tree you just can't bring yourself to run, legs frozen to the ground. It gets close, uncomfortably so. It briefly sniffs your chest and then looks up at you innocently. Seeing that the deer is being quite passive you're able to calm down a bit.

You were even going to reach out a hand to pat it, but the deer...
115321111.title: A Lone Stag

choices: "I grow bigger whenever a tree in my forest is harmed in an unnatural way."
"Im going to keep growing so I can hopefully protect all the forests on Earth!"
1153211111.content:
You reach out your hand to pat the wild deer on the side of the head, but you flinch and pull back when the deer's body suddenly lurches upwards a few inches. As you try to process what you just saw your caught off-guard yet again when the deer looks up to you and opens its mouth to speak! "Hello, human." It said in a smooth, masculine voice.
"W-w-what?!" You spit out. "D-did you just speak?"
"I did." He replied, still training his brown eyes on you.
"How?!"
"I was recently selected to be the forest guardian. I was granted special powers so I may protect these lands." The stag plainly explained. "I wish to ask something of you."
"What do you want?" You say as you nervously wipe sweat off your forehead. Looking down at the deer you can definitely see that it was getting bigger, his frame slightly bulging at random intervals. "And why me?"
"I need your help in finding the elements that endangers this forest. You're a human that emanates a strong connection to nature, so I believe that you will be invaluable in my mission to protect the forest."

You slow your breathing and try and take in what he just said while the stag looks at you expectantly, waiting for an answer. Despite the absurdity of the situation, being the sidekick of a mythical creature trying to defend the forest sounded really appealing to you. To top that off he specifically approached you, of all people! You stare at nothing in particular as you run the facts through your head. You've made a decision.

"I'll help!" You exclaim. Your a little bit shocked, however, to see that the deer is now eye level with you. "But why are you growing like that, though?"
"Oh," the deer says. "I'm growing so that I can better defend the forest, of course! More specifically..."
1153211111.title: The Forest Guardian

11532111111.content:
"...I grow bigger whenever a tree in my forest is harmed in an unnatural way." The stag explains. As if to emphasize the point his body suddenly jumps up a few inches, making him taller than you. "The bigger I get, the easier it should be to protect the forest."

Looking at the stag you think he must be around 6'5 now. The forest was also fairly large, and if any and all human-caused harm to trees caused the guardian to grow, you imagined he would end up getting much more bigger as time goes on. The thought of the deer before you towering above the forest filled you with equal parts anxiousness and anticipation. The deer turns away and speaks to you. "We should begin our search for those that would harm the forest, friend." Looking back, he chuckles. "Maybe you can ride on my back."

You couldn't help but grin, this was all too much like a sappy fantasy movie. As you step toward the deer, however...
11532111111.title: Tree Fueled Growth

choices: You manage to guide him to the camp
115321111111.content:
As you take a step toward the deer his frame suddenly billows outward a whole foot, causing the stag to gasp in surprise. You watch the deer brace himself as another growth spurt starts, quickly adding another foot of height. With a long moan, the deer stretches higher and higher, slowly growing higher and higher. You back up from the growing stag, the sight of him growing with no control making you slightly worried. Between pants and the stop-start motion of the growth, the deer looks down at you and ask "W-what are they doing to my forest?"

You just look up at him, dumbfounded by his size. He was about 10 feet tall and still growing. "Um..." You start, interrupted by a grunt from the deer as he surges another two feet. "If I remember correctly there's a logging company that was setting up not far from here. I guess they've started?"
The guardian was slow to reply, too preoccupied with his growth. "We must stop them!" He brazenly exclaims, regaining his composure and standing up to his full height at 15 feet. He was by far the biggest animal you have ever seen, and he was still growing. After riding out a particular long growth spurt, he turns his attention to you.
"Take me to the logging camp!" He begs you as he lowers himself into a sitting position. "You can climb up on my back and show me the way."
"Easier said than done." You whisper to yourself. Even sitting down he towered over you. You take a step toward the growing deer and put a hand on the side of its belly. Now at 20 feet his growth was starting to slow down, but you could still feel as his muscles stretching and his fur lengthening.

Going down to his back legs you start to clamber up his massive body, using the deer's thigh as a stepping ladder of sorts. Standing up on his thigh you could just barely see over his rump. Grabbing onto his thick fur you pull yourself up, scrambling to balance yourself on the deer's back so you don't slide off. Looking up you get a feeling of vertigo as the stag slowly dominates more of your view and the ground gets further away. The deer turns his head, watching you crawl along his back until you get to the base of his neck. "Are you ready?" He asks, his voice booming.
"Yes!" You say as you tighten your grip around his tree trunk sized neck.

With that he stands. You could feel air rush by you as he rises to his full height of 25 feet.

"Guide me, human."
115321111111.title: Unexpected Growth

choices: You finally arrive at the logging operation.
1153211111112.content:
The deer had been walking for a while now with you sitting on his back guiding him. You felt like you were making good distance and going the right direction but you should have arrived at the new logging camp by now. Perhaps it was the fact you were looking at the forest from a different angle or because the branches of the trees were starting to obscure your vision. Since setting off the forest guardian had been steadily growing larger, the fur of his neck lengthening and widening in your hands as you held on. At a guess he must have already doubled in size after you took position on his back.

You also noticed that he seemed to be growing a bit faster than before. Given his size, his body was brushing up closely against all the trees in the forest as he sauntered his way through it. Twigs and branches snapped from every direction around you and with the way he was constantly stopping and tilting his neck, you guessed his antlers were no longer fitting between the tree trunks. When one of the large velvety protrusions snagged against a trunk and brought down half the tree in a thunderous crash you could feel the deer let out a quick gasp before he quickly expanded for a moment. The deer seemed to be grunting in frustration at the fact but you had to ask him on the off chance he didn't notice.

"Hey, uh... Guardian?" You call out to him. "When you said you get bigger if a tree gets hurt in an unnatural way - does that include if you harm them by accident, too?

The deer stopped and grumbled. "Maybe. A giant deer carving a path through the forest definitely isn't natural." His voice boomed all around you as it bounced off the surrounding trees. It sounded much more louder and powerful now. You didn't want to get into an argument with such a huge creature set out on a divine mission but his reply only raised more questions.

"I thought that whatever power made you the forest guardian would have took that into account?"

Again, a loud crunching sound rung out before he jolted upwards a couple of feet again. "Gods work in mysterious ways, human. It's not like I'm relishing in destroying the forest I was tasked to protect." You decide to drop the conversation out of equal parts intimidation and respect, since it sounded like he was not too pleased with the fact himself. "Are we there yet?" He boomed.

When you took too long to respond the sounds of crunching branches came to a stop as he stood still. "Are we going the right way, human?"

You hesitated for a moment but the fact his body was still constantly inching higher reminded you that it was important to talk to him sooner rather than later. "I don't know. I can't see where we're going anymore from up here. The tree branches are in the way and the fact your neck is getting too thick for me to look past isn't helping either. Sorry."

The massive deer merely sighed. "It's not your fault. The higher ups definitely could have planned this better. I do have a plan, though." You flinched as the huge neck before you began to shift, followed by a cacophony of cracking and crunching. Not a moment later you could feel gravity pull you deeper into the deer's lengthening fur as he grew. You realized that he was intentionally destroying the trees to make himself bigger. In-between a sharp gasp or a quick moan, you could hear the guardian quickly mutter a sorry to the trees he was wrecking. Eventually he stopped and raised his head.

Looking up, the sky seemed closer as you could barely make out the tops of the trees. Trailing your gaze up his neck however, it stretched upwards until it breached that top and stood above the canopy. His antlers stood proud and free from any entangling trees. A moment of awe hit you as you realized that meant he was over a hundred feet tall. He stretched his body a bit as if he was relieving some knots in his muscles. By itself it wasn't much of a movement, but at this staggering size it was like experiencing an earthquake and you were bowled over until you were sitting down in the indent between his shoulders.

Grabbing the course fur for support you calm yourself down as you get over the fact you could have easily fallen to your death just then. You can see his head turning to the side as he looks at you out the corner of his eye. "Oh! Sorry, human! What little movements I now make must be quite the experience for you down there. I'll try my best to keep that in mind as he continue. Now, as for plan." Slowly he turned his head forward again and arched his neck down. "Please climb up. I'm sure I'm large enough you can use my head as a proper vantage point now."

You sat and stared at the long, furry road ahead of you. He wanted you to climb all that? Regardless, considering the fact the climb was getting longer by the minute thanks to the work of the loggers out in the forest, you urged yourself to get started. Standing up you stumbled along his back until you reached his neck and began climbing. You were making good distance as you were able to pull yourself up easily on his thick fur but the slight wobbles as he idly moved kept scared you into stopping since you were aware just how high up you were now. Down below you could hear the cracking of branches as his body continued to slowly grow and push into the surrounding forest in what felt like a constant feedback loop.

At last, though, you make it to the base of his head and muster the courage to look up from the tawny brown fur below you. The view left you awestruck for a moment as you took in the sight. He had grown large enough that most of neck was poking through the canopy giving you a clear view of the surrounding forest and distant landscape. You could even see the city in the distance. The view downward wasn't so awe inspiring, however. Moving over to one of his velvety antlers and holding onto it for support, you could just see past his muzzle and see the ground which made your stomach lurch with each small movement he made. It didn't help it seemed to be getting further away.

"Can you guide me from up there, human?" He asked.

"I, uh... I think so." From this new vantage point you could definitely make out some landmarks and you even think you could see the black exhaust fumes from the logging machinery rising up in the distance. "It's a little to your left, that way"

"That way we go, then." The deer bellowed before turning. You wrapped as much of your arm around his antler as you could when he started moving. He seemed to be doing his best keeping his head level but it still felt you like you were on a boat on a choppy sea. You sure hoped the black fumes were the source of the disturbance in the forest because it felt like the deer was growing more steadier and faster now, the antler to your side giving out a gentle creaking sound as it grew. Thankfully you were approaching a small clearing that seemed to be hiding the source of the smoke.
1153211111112.title: Lost in a shrinking forest

choices: It talks, and grows a little bit!
115321112.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You continue to slowly back away from the deer, which you guessed was a doe from the lack of antlers. But as you try to put distance between you and the wild animal, it continually matches your speed, intent on closing the distance between you for some reason. You take your eyes off it to look for a way out of the situation, then look back at it, as --

You yelp in surprise and trip over backwards, the sight of the deer suddenly right in front of you being far more of a shock than it probably should have been. Somehow, the doe had cleared a twenty foot gap in maybe a second, while being completely silent. You are about to start shuffling backwards when the deer carefully places a single small hoof on your chest, the amount of pressure being exerted on you almost nonexistent, and stares into your eyes with its own deep brown orbs.

What does the deer do next?
115321112.title: A Doe, A Deer, A Female Deer

choices: Growth-hungry, and power-hungry. Let the growth commence!
Gentle, but extremely interested in her new size and ability to talk.
1153211122.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Hesitantly, you reach a hand up to the deer's belly and begin to slowly stroke it, rubbing it back and forth. The deer shudders for a second before reciprocating, softly nuzzling you as you grace it with affection. As you rub it, a series of small twitches race across her back, then another and another.

Worried about your new friend, you are about to get up when you realise that the hoof gently pinning you to the ground was... Growing...

Stunned, you look at the doe, who is slowly creeping higher, her body slowly growing bigger and bigger. A sudden spurt rocks her body, shooting her up to six feet tall -- she's as tall as you, now, and still growing!

Her forelegs buckle and give way, and she flumps onto you, covering more and more of your body with her soft, furry bulk. She quickly regains control of the two limbs, and you both stand up, the deer now towering almost two feet over you.

She then opens her mouth and begins to speak!

But what does she sound like?
1153211122.title: Deer-y Me

choices: She restrains her growth... Before she has another hiccuping fit!
11532111222.content:
Original author: Infinity421

"Are you okay, little one?" The massive deer asks, causing your mouth to drop open from shock. "Uh, I, I guess so?" You reply, too stunned to form a coherent reply. "I do not know what you did to make me this big, little one, but I thank you for it!" The doe cheerfully and sweetly exclaims before thinking for a second. "Perhaps I grow when you rub my belly? Please, test this with me."

You rub the doe's pure white, furry belly, hearing her stomach rumble loudly as you continue to rub away from underneath her. Her legs twitch slightly and she splays them apart in a wider stance as she begins to grow ever so slightly. As her size increases, so too does her growth rate, centimetres gained slowly shifting into inches...

You hug one of the expanding doe's legs, feeling it pulse larger, thicker, and wider in your grasp. The doe giggles and pushes her massive head into you, which at her new height of nine feet tall was over twice the size of your own! Her growth slowly slows down to nothing, the small spurt coming to a rest as she reaches ten feet tall.

The doe lets loose a loud hiccup, the vibrations travelling down her body. Then she hiccups again. And again. And again.

Her entire body shakes violently, and you can see her powerful muscles tense up as she restrains her growth all for naught, as she begins to flow outwards...

1153221112.content:
Original author: RedHurricane

You were at the zoo one day when it happened. You had taken a turn into the large mammals exhibit and hear a grunt. You turn your head and see a hippopotamus in an exhibit. The hippo was a reddish purple color and looked like it was bigger than an average hippo. You walk closer and see that the hippo was in fact female and she was chewing on several cabbages. You smile and take a photograph that startles the she-hippo slightly.

The hippo grunts and then turns to you. You step back slightly because you knew how hostile hippos could be. But instead the hippo walks to the side of the exhibit and snorts as she sniffs you. You give an uneasy look but the hippo seems friendly and smiles at you as she grunts.

You reach in and rub the hippo by her snout and from the sounds of her grunting, she is happy to have the attention. You guess this hippo wasn't too territorial. Suddenly you hear a whistling in the air and see a meteorite land in front of the hippo's cabbages.

You're in awe, but the hippo turns and walks up to the meteorite, obviously not knowing what it was. The hippo opens her mouth wide and mistaking the meteorite for another cabbage, she takes it in her mouth and chews it to bits before she begins to eat it.

And that's when it happens, the hippo begins to glow as she grunts and then you gasp because she appears to be growing bigger. The hippo expands and in seconds she's bigger than an elephant and keeps growing. Everyone in the area gasps and moves back. The hippo keeps getting bigger and soon she reaches
1153221112.title: A Day at the Zoo

11532211121.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

You can't help but stare as the she-hippo inflates ever, ever larger; already at an impossible size--heck, just suddenly growing like this, from eating a meteor no less, was supposed to be impossible in itself! And yet...there she was, inflating to the size of a house...then a medium house...then a full blown mansion. All the while, people begin to inch away, still taking the odd picture or video of the prodigious pachyderm as she continues to magnify. By now she's easily 80 feet tall, and barely fitting in her exhibit pen--her ever-increasing rear and belly pressing against the Plexiglass wall with more and more pressure...

And just in time, common sense kicks in.

"Everyone away from the walls!" You bellow, ducking behind a nearby bench. "TAKE COVER NO--"

KRACK-THUNK! The pressure is at last too much for the walls of the hippo's pen, and they violently give way, sheets of Plexiglass jumping from the metal frame in many directions, too heavy to fly far but fast enough to injure if they hit somebody. Luckily, your warning was heeded and nobody was hurt at all. Ducking behind the bench had even been unnecessary; none of the walls had reached that distance.

But now your attention went back to the hippo. Understandably, since she was now outside of her pen. And 200 feet tall. No, 300....400...450...

Finally, the glow faded from her massive, 500-foot form, revealing the same reddish-purple she-hippo from earlier...only at a Brobdingnagian scale. She could probably crush a tank by sitting on it, easily! Heck, her feet had left craters in the walkway when she'd exited her pen! Along with the rest of the crowd, you stared up at her, waiting for some cue to either approach, or run for the hills.

The hippo snorts, shaking its head as if confused. She cranes her neck around this way and that, like she was just now noticing her newfound size...and the tiny humans who were staring at her.

You shook off your disbelief and shock to listen to the crowd's chattering whispers.

"Hey, look! Is it...smiling?"

"Mommy, is the big hippo smilin'?"

"Oh, now what?!"

Wait, smiling? The hippo? Confused, you re-focus on the massive, office-building-sized hippo to find an unmistakable smile on her gargantuan lips.
But this was a very specific kind of smile...
11532211121.title: The Zoo's "Biggest" Attraction!

Suddenly, she begins glowing dimly. You look in surprise as she starts slowly growing. She stops when she's about three to four times your height, and looks down at you as she stops glowing. You can only stand there confused and a bit scared, knowing elephants can kill people easily, and now this one was bigger than any elephant you'd seen before. She cocks her head in a cute way, and flicks her ears. You just keep looking up at her, wondering what she's planning to do.

You get your answer when her trunk moves towards you, sniffing at you. You try to back away, but you're already against the pen wall. The elephant girl stops and lets out a quiet growl of satisfaction, as if you passed some kind of test when she sniffed at you. Before you can react, her trunk shoots towards you again, passing by your left side and curling completely around you. You can't help but shout and beat on the trunk with your fists as her grip tightens, her trunk coiling around your body. She easily plucks you off the ground, and then moves her trunk (and you) so you're parallel to the ground. Your hands and feet dangle a ways above the ground, and you're completely helpless to do anything as she starts walking back, deeper into the pen.

As you near a cave entrance, she starts coiling you tighter, as if she expects something. Then...

122122.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Thunk.

What the? You blearily open your eyes, convinced you just heard something. It was probably just the neighbour's dog again, nothing to worry abou-

THUNK.

You stop mid thought, your mind reaffirming that it did, in fact, hear a very loud thumping noise from downstairs. Swearing, you grab your baseball bat from under your bed - you were always a bit paranoid about this kind of thing, which seems to have paid off - and stealthily move downstairs to confront your would-be, unskillful burglar.

Positioning the bat so that you can easily swing it with one hand, you creepy into the living room, which was completely black, and move for the switch by virtue of spatial memory. You prepare to charge and swing at the burglar, and flick on the lights.

In front of you stood a green dragon, looking very uncomfortable. It's legs were positioned on the side of its body, both of them thick, and vaguely semicircular in appearance, with three long, yellow claws emerging from the lowest, foremost part of them.

It also had two comparatively short arms, both positioned close to its legs, with two claws on the end. You look upwards, at its head. It was long as sloped, and the same light green as the rest of its body. It had two yellow eyes, its pupils being a solid red, small, thin trails of smoke emerging from its nostrils, which were on the end of its muzzle. It had two short ears, directly above which were two long, yellow horns, which were pressing into the ceiling, as it was so large. There was also a large red spike on the top of its head, surrounded by a dark green patch of scales. There were more along its back, going to the end of its long tail. Two short, stubby wings with yellow membranes emerged from its back, most likely for show.

It had a vivid yellow underbelly, running all the way from underneath its head to the end of its tail, with uniform orange stripes breaking up the solid colour.

You honestly weren't sure what to do, or even what to think. The dragon was studying you closely, seemingly eager to find a way to stop its horns from damaging the ceiling and walk over to you before wrapping you into a hug with those big green arms. You noted that the shape of the dragon was akin to an 'S', with its arms being at the middle bend, and its legs shortly underneath.

That underbelly looked...soft. A thought enters your mind, of the dragon laying asleep on the floor, you wrapped up in a hug, pressed into its yellow belly. That would be fun...

What happens next?
122122.title: Accidental Invasion

1222111.title: Adult Dragon

choices: Ket wakes up in the night you up terrified of the storm
12221111.content:
Original author: Redfang3986

You see a small human boy standing outside waiting for you. You knew this boy, his name was Ket and he often visited you. He was a friendly little guy, if you got to know him. Most of the time he was shy, but if you waited long enough and were nice to him. Then he would definitely warm up to you. Ket had been told by the villagers to stay away from your lair, but he came to see you anyway. You liked Ket, he wasn't all that strong, or all that smart but his presence filled you with joy for some reason and you always enjoyed it when he visited.

Ket stood at a little under four feet and was about ten years old. He was small for his age, but that didn't matter to you. He was dressed in a simple tunic with torn pants. His skin was very pale and he had blue eyes. What you found to be his most unique and unusual quality was his hair. It was smooth and came down in a mop over his head, but it was the color of his hair that made him stand out. It was sky blue. He told you that he was often picked on or avoided because of this. People thought that he was a freak or possessed and stayed away from him. Even his own parents abandoned him. You were his only true friend. At least that's how he saw you.

You didn't see Ket as your friend you saw him more as your student or your charge. You believe that you were Ket's teacher or guardian. Whenever he came along you would always try and teach him something or read to him. You tried your best to teach Ket about the world and other subjects. Such as history, math, language and the like. Other times you would tell him a story or cheer him up when he's sad. All in all you deeply cared for Ket and worried about him. Again you have no idea why but you didn't really care.

"Hi Bahimut!" (Bah-he-mutt) The boy shouted with glee. He ran up to you and you lowered your snout and nuzzled him gently. Ket hugged you as best he could. After a few moments you let go and looked down at him. He was covered in dirt and bare foot. Which was concerning. You knew he had shoes and it was a long trek up to your cave, you hoped he didn't have any injuries. "Ket, show me your feet", you said. Ket happily lifted his foot. There were small cuts on his sole. He then showed you the other foot and it to had small cuts. All the cuts were bleeding but didn't look infected. "Where are your shoes, Ket", you asked concerned.

The boy tried to look away but you made him look at you. "Answer me." You made your voice a little sterner. "The village chief took them to prevent me from coming here", he said defeated. "He doesn't want me to see you anymore. He says your evil and will eat me. But I don't believe him. He's a big dummy." The boy finished and looked up at you, tears forming in his eyes. You bend down and nuzzle him gently. You can understand where the chief was coming from. You were a dragon and you were big and intimating, but you were also kind and would never harm someone much less eat them, unless they did something unforgivable. Again even in those cases the worst you would do is probably scare them or remove their means of hurting you.

But humans didn't see this. In your long life you have been told by fellow dragon that humans attack what they don't understand. So you could see the villagers concern with letting a child hang out with such a big dragon. They were scared. You thought it might be best to end this right now. Scare Ket off so that he never comes back. It would certainly make his life better and he would get his shoes back. But as your about to even consider doing this, you look into Ket's tear filled eyes and realize you can't. He saw you as his only friend, the only person that liked him, you couldn't bring yourself to take that away from the little guy. You continue to nuzzle him till he calms down then look him in the eyes,

"It's all right", you say to him. "If you want to keep seeing me keep coming. It doesn't matter what anyone says. It's your choice." You nuzzle him a little more till you hear him giggle. You nuzzle him a little more before letting up. "So, what are we going to do today?" He asked looking up at you with hope filled eyes. You smile down at him and scoop him up in your paw and bring him to your eye level. You give him a little kiss then place him on your back. "Well first thing were going to do is, heal those feet of yours and remove any infections you may have." You state while walking inside your cave.

"You mean your going to use magic", he asked gleefully.
"Yup", you answered.
"Yay", he shouted happily. "I love seeing your magic."

It was true you were a dragon that knew magic. Many of you kind did, but magic was a very frightful thing to humans and it was considered the work of the devil. But you never used that kind of magic. The only magic you ever used was to make your stories come alive or for healing and protection purposes. Ket loved seeing images of the story you told him. He would clap squeal with joy when he was happy, cuddle up against you when he was scared of a monster or bad guy he saw, and sometimes he would move so close to the images that your magic produced that he could reach out and touch them. He only did this when he was getting excited. You always enjoyed how he'd react and didn't care that using magic like that made you tired.

"After your feet feel better, I was going to teach you a little bit about multiplication. But since your feeling down I'll skip the lesson and tell you a story instead." This earned you a hug as the boy wrapped his arms around your neck as best he could. "Also there's a big storm coming and I don't want you to run home in it so you can either spend the night with me or I can fly you down to the village." Ket looked up at you excited. He had never seen you fly and was probably surprised to learn that you could.

"You can fly", he shouts!
You smile at him. "You didn't think these wings were just for show did you?" You flex your wings and Ket stares at them in awe. He reaches out and touches it. You loved how excited he seemed to be about flying. "Yes, Ket I'll fly you down to the village, but you could also spend the night with me and I'll fly you down once the storm lets up. This one looks like it's going to last a while." Ket looks at you again with happy eyes and wonders what he should do. You swear you can see smoke coming out of that head of his. "Would you like me to decide for you", you ask? He nods.

"I think you should stay here. I know the villagers will worry about you, but I also know that you live alone and are terrified when your alone. Plus you'll still get to fly on my back when I take you there tomorrow, okay." The kid hugs your neck again and you take this as a yes. Now to move on to healing his feet. You walk deep into your cave where a small glowing spring is waiting. You slowly pick Ket up and put his feet in the spring. You lift him out and the cuts on his feet are gone. Looking at the spring you mutter something and dip your free paw in and purify the water. You then set Ket down near the far end of the cave and fetch some small trees from the corner. You lay them down in front of him and use your fire breath to light them ablaze. You then lay down and watch as he cuddles up against you, fearful of the flame.

"It's okay, Ket", you whisper softly. "Just stay close to me and it won't hurt you." The boy presses closer to you and you mutter something. The flame turns blue and images form in the smoke. Finally you wrap your tail around his body and begin your story. He listens closely and time flies by. You look up and realize it's night and the storm has just begun. You end your story there, put out the flame, cuddle Ket and wait for him to fall asleep. When he closes his eyes and your sure he's asleep and you gently drift to sleep.
12221111.title: A human kid who is happy to meet you.

choices: For now we shrink...but maybe some growth later.

1222111122.content:
Your eyes slowly open. You had an interesting dream last night. You dreamed that you had to protect Kent from a terrible formless beast. But it was too big and managed to pin you down easily. You wouldn't let it take Kent. You wouldn't let ANYONE take Kent away from you. Suddenly, in the dream, you started growing and growing! Soon the formless mass dropped Kent and ran away in fear, as Kent fell into your paw. You brought him to your face and smiled softly. He looked at you in awe and hugged your muzzle. At that point the dream ended.

When you awoke, you noticed that things looked...smaller...MUCH smaller. You then realize something: You had grown huge! You were probably 500 feet now! Your cave was just BARELY big enough to hold you in. How in the world did you grow so big? Was it the dream perhaps? Regardless, you have grown massively.

Soon Kent started waking up. He looked around as he saw a lot of white scales. He looked up and showed a face of complete shock at your current size. You were worried that Kent would be fearful of your new size. Instead however, he exclaimed "Wow! You got soooo biiiiig!" He says amazed. You couldn't help but feel a bit proud at his love of your current size."Indeed I have. Though, this was not intended." You tell him. "But what now? Can you even fit out of your cave?" Kent asks. You shake your head sighing. "I can barely fit in here as is. There is no chance I can get without breaking it." You reply.

"Well, what if you got even bigger? Then you could outgrow your cave!" He cheers. You chuckle and shake your head. "I think a better idea would be trying to use magic to shrink down." You say. Though, a part of you, a very small part, wanted to grow even bigger as well. You had never felt this way before. Perhaps it was because of Kent's positive encouragement for growth combined with the admittedly pleasurable feeling of being so large and powerful. You wouldn't abuse your power, but maybe you could change peoples minds on dragons if you were even bigger.
1222111122.title: A truly BIG dragon

choices: Your rage causes you to grow back to five hundred feet
you calm down and decide to leave your home with Ket
12221111222.content:
"No" you say. Ket looks down feeling a little saddened that he doesn't get to see you get any bigger. You decide to kneel down and gently nuzzle him to cheer the little one up. "Listen to me, Ket", you start. "Truthfully I want to see if I can get bigger to. But I also don't want to destroy my home, or much worse risk hurting you with my growth. So instead I think I'll focus on shrinking back down, okay." Ket doesn't meet your eyes. You realize he really wanted to see you get bigger and that makes you feel a little guilty about your decision. "But if you behave, maybe I'll grow a little later." The boy's eyes immediately light up. "Promise!?" He exclaims. Chuckling you say, "Yes but only if your good. Now stand back I need to focus." Ket obeys and gets as far back from you as possible.

You close your eyes and begin focusing. Channeling your magic, you imagine yourself getting smaller. It works, your body slowly begins to shrink. You decide not to go back to your original height and settle for the moment at merely a hundred feet. When your done, you open your eyes and look around. Good, you could move around more easily. Gently laying down, you turn your gaze over to Ket whose eyes glitter with excitement. Before you can even get a word out he runs up to you and hugs your chest tightly. He giggles happily and says "You didn't shrink all the way."

Smiling you cover his body with your paw. "Well I thought it would be boring if I shrunk all the way back down. Plus you seem to like me big. So I thought this would be a nice way to compromise." Ket hugged you tighter. Satisfied with the kid's happiness you carefully listen outside. The storms still going on but you can hear something else out there. The marching of boots, the sound of voices and the smell of humans. Your body tenses up and you carefully look down at Ket, who's still hugging you oblivious to what's going on outside. You listen closely and can hear the voices clearer now.

"But what if it eats us", says a panicked young man. "Well just have to kill it before it has the chance", says another. "What about Ket", asked a third. "What about the little hell spawn?" You utter a soft growl at that insult. Ket looks up at you a little worried. "What's wrong", he ask. For the moment you ignore Ket and focus on the voices. "We gave him plenty of chances, took him in when his parents abandoned him, raised him, clothed him, fed him. We warned him about that monster. The elder took away his shoes and still the little heathen went to see that thing. As far as I'm concerned he dies with that dragon."

You bare your fangs as flames flicker at the corners of your mouth. Your free paw digging into the ground and your tail lashes the hard rock floor. They were talking about killing Ket, just for being close to you. No, you would not let that happen. You promised yourself that no one was allowed to hurt Ket, no one was going to separate you two. No one was going to kill him. Just then you heard sniffling and looked down to see the little one staring up at you with fear in his eyes on the verge of tears. You stopped and realized you were scaring him. You gently crane your head down and nuzzle him. "Shh, I's okay Ket, everything's okay. Everything will be okay."

You weren't quite sure how to explain this to Ket. But you decided it would be best if he didn't know. "Ket I need you to listen to me. I need you stay here while I go outside." "What, why?" He asked innocently. "The villagers are here to... talk to me about you. I need you to stay here and no matter what you do, do not go outside, okay?" Ket trembles for a moment. "But", he starts. "No" you state. "No buts, I need you to listen to me and stay right here okay." You say again sterner. The little human knows better then to argue with you when you use that tone of voice, so he simply gives a dejected okay. "Good i'll be right back." You get up and begin to leave just then you feel something grab your tail. Looking back you see Ket hug your tail. "Be careful." You give him a reassuring smile and walk out into the rain.

They've gathered quite the number you notice. At your original height this might have been a problem but standing at a hundred feet tall, this wasn't that bad. You could probably scare half of them away with a growl. Looking down at they, they didn't think you'd be this big. Some of them already looked like they were going to wet themselves just from your presence alone. There were around twenty of them with pitchforks, torches, hoe's and other farming equipment, not really suitable for hunting a dragon. They didn't have any armor with them either. After surveying the situation you were certain the villagers were no threat to you, but the could easily hurt Ket.

"Yo what do I owe the pleasure of this fine visit", you ask somewhat angry. A villager in the back shouted in fright. "It talks!" The leader a big burly man built like a wall obviously the leader, shouts back, "Shut up! Who cares if it talks! It'll die all the same! It and that little brat it has with it." At this you swing your tail knocking the pitchfork out the human's hand and lean in close to him growling intensely. "Never talk about Ket like that in my presence, human. That boy is as sweet as they come and If I ever hear you talk about him like that again I'll burn you to ash." You'd never actually do that but you had experience dealing with humans before. No matter how big they talked threaten them a little and they'd usually back down. Usually being the key word here, this was not one of those times.

While most of the villagers coward in fear and few even ran away, the leader stood his ground and stared you dead in they eyes. "Doesn't matter how big you are, we'll still take you down." Just then you hear a familiar voice from behind you. "Stop fighting!" You swing your head around see Ket standing in the rain drenched and on the verge of tears. "Please can't we just talk-", Ket didn't get to finish that sentence as one of the humans hurled a rock at his head. The boy screamed in pain and fell to the ground. He laid there crying as the scent of blood hit your nostrils. You turned your full attention back to the villagers as you wrapped your tail defly around Ket positioning yourself between him and them. Through barely containded anger you utter "How dare you."
12221111222.title: For now we shrink...but maybe some growth later.

choices: Grow even bigger! Become a god-like Dragon!
Hold back on the growth for now, wait till you understand it all.
122211112221.content:
You couldn't help but feel enraged. These humans were so disgusting and so vile to a child like Ket, that you can't help but begin to grow back to your previous massive size in rage. The humans look utterly shocked and terrified as you grow to 150 feet, then 250 feet, then 500 feet finally. You look down at the now puny humans. It felt good to get them to shut up like this, especially since they didn't seem to be afraid before. Every villager except for the leader ran away in fear. The leader looked back at them shouting "Cowards! God will smite you when you perish!" Then he stops and looks up, up and up at your huge form. You then lower your head to him. "So...what was that about taking me down?" You ask confidently smirking.

He quivered and shook, and then bolted back down the mountain side crying in fear and terror. You feel good, and then look back at Kent, hoping he's not too scared. Quite the opposite actually. He loves to see you so big, as he hugs your tail gleefully. You had to admit, it felt nice to be so large and powerful, especially since it made it much easier to protect Kent. "Thanks for protecting me." Kent says smiling up at your face. You smile back, bringing him close to your face with your tail and gently nuzzle him. "It's no trouble." You say.

It really was no trouble actually. This growth didn't even tire you out like you thought it would. If anything, it made you feel even more magically and physically powerful somehow. But how though? Was this just a new facet of your magic you had discovered? Or could it be because you did for Kent instead of yourself? This required a bit of testing. You decide to do this for one reason only: To make Kent happy to see you even bigger. You focus, and the feeling of growth courses through your body as you expand once again. Bigger and bigger you swell, reaching 1000 feet before you decide to stop.

"Whoooooa! You got even bigger!" Kent shouts in joy. Luckily you could hear and see him just fine. Your senses seem to have been improved thanks to the magic of this size changing. And you had to admit...just growing felt really good. Pleasurable even. Once again, you also feel more powerful with your magic, and not just your physical strength. In fact, your magic powers seem to be preventing your paws from breaking the mountain you stood on. "Indeed I did." You say in response Kent's exclamation. "Can you get even bigger?" He asks, his eyes shining with excitement. You ponder for a moment. Sure, it would be nice to grow even bigger, and feel the power surge through you, but you don't want to lose yourself to the growth.
122211112221.title: Growing angry dragon

choices: The 'real' god is not happy with this, but is too weak to stop you.
You absorbed the real god long ago, and the power has finally awakened.
1222111122211.content:
You couldn't help it anymore. The growth...it felt way too good. But you wanted to at least keep a calm appearance, so you say to Kent "Very well, I will indulge you a bit and grow some more." You say, which causes him to cheer with glee. You focus your powers, desiring to make yourself bigger for Kent's sake, and a bit of your own. This time, you don't hold back, and grow rapidly. 1000 feet quickly becoming 2000 feet as you expand in ever direction. You couldn't help but murr at how pleasing this surge in size feels. You chant in your head Bigger, bigger, BIGGER, BIGGER! the bigger you get, the more pleasing the growth, and the bigger you want to get. Eventually, you surge straight up to a mile tall and don't seem to be stopping. "Yaaaaaay!" You hear Kent cheer, enjoying you growth. You place him on your back so he's somewhere safe, as you felt like you were just getting started. "Get ready to watch Kent. Cause I've just gotten started." You tell him confidently to which he cheers and you grow even more.

The whole village from which Kent was from looks up in awe and fear of the 2 mile tall dragon that was looming over them, whose paw could easily smush the entire town into nothing but dust. You don't care for them though.They're so tiny compared to you, they couldn't even hurt you if they tried. You felt so strong. So powerful. You felt like...a God. The thought was incredibly enticing to feel as you reach 5 miles tall. Kent was just there on your back, cheering on your incredible growing form. "What do you think Kent? Aren't I amazing?" You ask chuckling confidently. "Yeah! You're super amazing!" He yells with joy.

You chuckle. "Good. Because I'm not even close to being done yet." You boast and grow faster now. You reach 10 miles easily, your body beginning to glow with a godly light. People from around the world bow before you, whether in fear or respect, you don't care. Because you just are way too into the growth right now to actually care. "BIGGER...BIGGER...BIIIGGERRRR!" You boom in a voice that is loud and yet not loud, your very being bending the laws of reality to your whim. On and on you grew, a hundred miles tall seeming like such an order of magnitude to those below, but for you, it's as easy as breathing. Kent is just giggling excitedly as he rides your seemingly endless back. "You're so huuuuuuge!" He cheers.

You chuckle, and pet him gently with your mighty tail, as gentle as you ever were with him and everyone else. Even at 1000 miles tall, with your paws smothering whole kingdoms under singular digits, your body refuses to hurt anyone, and you refuse to hurt anyone. You will not be like the rage filled humans who wish harm upon anyone they don't like or disagree with. You will be the new god of a new era of peace. You will not let anyone be hurt or hurt each other. You will bring untold and unimaginable prosperity to every atom of this world that now rests between your still growing paws. Kent was on your back, safe thanks to your magic creating an atmosphere for him to breathe in. "Woooooow! You're so strong!" He cheers. You couldn't help but chuckle proudly. "Indeed I am Kent. And with this power...I will ensure an age where everyone can be happy." You say, the whole world hearing that last bit. They cheer and bow before you, accepting you as the new God. Whether out of fear or respect, again, you care not. So long as you can make everyone in the world happy. However, you can't help but wonder...what does the 'real' God think of your growing and constantly ascending form of yours?
1222111122211.title: The Dragon God

choices: Shrink back down and head home
12221111222112.content:
As you ponder what the the real God would think you finally remember that long ago a traveler calling himself god challenged you and lost, with his defeat you recount the strange words he spoke. "I have taken the form of my creations and lost my power in time will be yours to do with as you see fit and my being will cease." It happened so long ago that you just now remember it. Could this be God's power and if it was just how far and how much could you do with it. Kent meanwhile continues to cheer on your ever growing form as the earth itself seems to shrink away as you grow bigger and bigger. You look at him and suddenly get an idea.

"Say Kent", you call down to him. He turns his head and looks at you. "I want to try something sit still." The boy obliges and you close your eyes and focus you can feel just how vast your power is and know that what you want would be no trouble at all. Snapping your eyes open a glow engulfs Kent. The glow expands at an incredibly rate meanwhile you shift your continuously growing body which has easily at this point matched the earth in size so that you are instead holding the glowing mass with your paws. All at once the glow fades and a very large and very confused looking blue hatchling is looking around up at you.

'Hm", you say to yourself. "Guess human years are different then dragons." The hatchling in your paws shakes his head a few times times and blinks before looking up at you and then at himself.

Then it speaks in Kent's voice. "What happened Bahimut", he asked looking around confused and a little alarmed. "why am I a", he trails off and you speak again.

"I wanted to do something nice fore you", you start. "Without you this may not have even been possible. Furthermore, I know you don't have any parents and even in the new world order that i'm creating i'm sure you don't want to go back to your village because of how they treated you. And", you glance and glare down at Kent's village, the villagers in question swallow nervously. "I myself do not want you to go to a place where you are not loved. Even though I would never hurt you no matter what size I am, I wanted to do this to both give you a home and a family. But it seems that while you may be a ten year old human child. Ten years as a dragon still makes you a hatchling. I know it will be a hard change but-oof." Your interrupted as Kent has managed to weasel out of your grip and tackle you in a hug.

While Kent may quite possibly be the biggest hatchling alive, he is still a hatchling, and compared to you that hug just surprised you more then anything else. He is now gripping your chest tightly his tail wagging happily. You take a moment before gently patting his head and embrace him yourself. After a few minutes you both look at each other and the continuously shrinking planet. Kent turns his attention back to you. "So", he begins. "Does this mean I'm your son?"

"You look at him. "I suppose it does", you reply still taking this all in.

"Can you make me older?"

"I could, but learning how to be a dragon would be easier if you were like this. So I think it might be for the best if for now you remained a hatchling."

"Okay", Kent replies cheerfully. "Can I change size to?"

"No", you reply. "This is something I acquired from the old god", but i will grow you in accordance to my height as I continue growing."

He looks slightly disappointing before brightening up again. "So as a dragon will you teach me how to fly?"

"Yes" you reply.

"How to breathe fire", he ask.

"Yes", you answer again.

"How to use magic?" This continues for a while, with Kent asking questions and you answering yes or no to them. All the while the two of you continue to grow bigger and bigger as the earth populace stare up in awe at their ever growing god and his kid. Eventually your internal Clock tells you that it's getting late. You decide that's enough questions for one day and with Kent pressed up against your chest you kneel down and very gently pick up the earth which is little more then this size of a marble to you now. Kent is curious so he ask to see it saying yes as long as he just looks, you begin wondering what to for bed.

You could shrink yourself and Kent back down and move right into your cave. Kent might not be very happy but you figure as long as he's with you he won't complain that much. You could also continue to test the limits of your new powers and just fashion a new lair into existence. Or you could simply sleep with in the vastness of space.

12222.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Alright, what time period is it?
12222.title: Human

122221.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

Sometimes, you wish you could have moved to a different village. Sure, the little hamlet was safe from bandits and the like, being built on a hill and sporting some respectable walls; it even had a river close by, which opened up some fishing and the occasional traders coming through on their boats. The harvests were usually good too, so even the lowliest peasants had a little something to eat. Heck, the tax-collectors were even friendly! The village was only a few days' ride from the nearest city, so the King's men weren't sporting saddle-sores and grumbling about being away from their homes when they rode into town.

The problem? Most villages answered to an earl, or a lord, or maybe an Archbishop or monk if there was a temple or monastery nearby. Your particular village answered to a dragon. A HUGE dragon, covered in white and gold scales and sporting green eyes and wings, who could easily crush a castle in one clawed foreleg. She always said she would never do such a thing, though, claiming she liked humans too much to even think of hurting them.

That didn't make her any less intimidating to you. Friendly or not, mountain-sized dragonesses were still scary to a little human such as yourself. Especially if they were towering over you like a scaly, living mountain; giving a friendly smile....that showed off a VERY impressive set of fangs.

"Good afternoon, little one." She greets you, faint smoke coming from her nostrils. "What brings you to you Lady's domain? Something the villagers need?"

Despite your nervousness, you can;t but smile back. Gigantic dragon or not, you couldn't deny that she treated her vassals well. "Y-yes, milady," you answer. "It...concerns the 'size-shifting' you've been undergoing recently. A freind of mine happened to come across you while he was hunting in the forest. You were trying to beat your last record of, erm, big-ness, and---well, you didn't see him and, well, you sat on him. He was unharmed, don't worry!" You add, noting her nervous expression, "but he was....somewhat flustered by the whole event, milady. His ranting in the tavern could be heard three streets over!"

The dragoness chuckles at that, and gives her answer....
122221.title: Under The Dragon's Wing

123111111111.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

You had to crane your little head up and up, near-vertical, to look up at the Mother-Rex...and then you lose your balance and fall flat on your back, still looking up at her. Most of the foliage barely cleared her haunches, and you saw that even the taller trees were harshly bent or tilted in sharp angles--likely brushed aside as the maternal titaness trudged through the jungle. She filled most of your vision just standing there, and just one of her feet was bigger than your whole body!

She had to be 500 feet tall, at the least.

Your mother chuckles at your little display, a sound that shakes the air. Not that you were intimidated; she may have been utterly gigantic even by T-Rex standards, but she was still your mother.

"Welcome to the world, little one!" She coos, reaching her massive head--easily dwarfing your form--down to nuzzle you. "You were putting up quite a fight inside that egg--I worried for a bit that you might hit your head coming out, or even knock it out of the nest!" Humming a dainty tune, that still shook ferns, rocks, and trees throughout the jungle from its volume, she sits down...and makes the ground shake; enough to toss you into the air and come back down on the nest with a little thud! Groggily, you sit back up, eyes spinning in dizziness from all the falling-down you've done fresh out of the egg.

Your mother had the grace to look embarrassed AND sympathetic. "Oh my--I do enjoy being this size, but sometimes it can be such trouble..." she mumbles, her tail swinging a lazy arc behind her. Several trees are cut down from the impact, and tumble down towards Terra Firma.

Shaking off the last of your dizziness, you walk over to your mother--lying her head on the ground with a warm grin--and return the nuzzle. "You didn't need to worry, Mama; I'm okay. Ooh; when I grow up, am I gonna as biiiiig as you? Are all grown-up Rexes as big as you?"

She chuckles again, shaking the air. "Well, I can't say if you'll be as big as me when you grow up, though I would like it. As for the other one...no, sweetie; most Rexes don't get anywhere near my size, even after they're all grown up!" She winked, and gave a fanged smirk. "Mama is one of the lucky ones--grew up near a nice little spring with fresh water, my parents--they were even bigger than me!--loved me very, very much. Who knows? Maybe you will get as big as me some day!"

You both trade nuzzles again; you especially like the idea of being her size--nobody with half a brain would mess with you! She even tells you a story about picking out this jungle nesting ground: when an annoying pack of raptors--bug-sized by your Mother's perspective--had refused to clear out, even though she'd asked nicely many, many times, she'd scared them all off...by casually sitting on the gang's leader as if he were an egg! She even quipped, "Keep my precious little one company, would you mind?"

After that, shed gotten off the pinned, embarrassed raptor, who promptly fled along with his gang. And this little neck of the jungle had been her home ever since. You break into belly-laughs at her story, clapping your little clawed forepaws. "Hahaha, that's great Mama! You showed them!"

She simply smirks in response. "Well, I had to do something to, heh, convince them to leave. They weren't doing anything here except bumming around all day and being lazy, and I thought it was the ideal nest-spot." She starts to add something to that, but stops mid-sentence. Gesturing for you to duck and be quiet, she lifts her head off the ground and sniffs at the air while looking around. After a brief, tense moment, she finds the scent she's looking for. She stares off into the distance, squinting into the jungle.

You risk a whisper, "Mama? What's wrong? What do you smell...?"

She starts a bit, looking back at you with an awkward smile--a towering fanged titan, and her own hatch-ling catches her off-guard! "Oh, nothing's wrong. Just smelled some...unexpected guests on their way. As for who they are..."
123111111111.title: Meeting Mega-Mommasaurus

choices: Kindness, as she decides to adopt you.
Fear. She is on top of a tall hill and you didn't even notice.
