1321112.content:
Original author: Wdearth

You're a bald eagle in the wild, your wingspan is about 8 feet, you stand about 2 feet tall, and one day, you see a human nearby and decide to fly down and perch in front of him. You spread out and flap your wings, which he happily takes photos of. A few minutes later, you suddenly feel tingly inside and grow until you're eye level with the human, you and the human look at each other in amazement and then you have that strange feeling again and grow to 12 feet tall with a wingspan of 48 feet. The human looks up at you, somewhat nervous now as you look down at him, confused. Then he says, "Wow, you've turned into a new ruler of the skies..." and you...
1321112.title: Growing

choices: Offer him a ride on your back.
Offer him a ride in your feet.
13211121.content:
Original author: Wdearth

You then say, "Um yeah, I guess I am now..." in a deep voice. Then his eyes widen. "You can talk?" and you reply, "Seems I've gotten a lot more intelligent as well as a lot bigger..." and he approaches your belly and hugs and snuggles it, you giggle and murr in response and then you...
13211121.title: Understand him

132112.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Alright, how big is the eagle to start off with?
132112.title: Human

choices: She grows to human height, then to twelve feet tall!
1321121.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You slowly trudge up the mountain path, hiking boots gripping the gravelly surface with ease. You always liked walking here, the path was so little used only you really remembered it was there. You hear a piercing cry from higher up the mountain, and see a dark shape begin to descend to you. The shape turns out to be a bald eagle, who perches on a nearby rock to watch you. You had seen the eagle before several times, although she had never come this close to you. You use your camera to take several pictures of her, which she seems to enjoy, and she flaps her wings to allow you to take some more impressive photos. Suddenly, you hear a loud growling being emitted from the eagle's stomach. Simply assuming she is hungry, you are surprised when...
1321121.title: Normal size.

choices: Caws softly - she can understand you, but cannot talk.
13211212.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Suddenly, the eagle shudders, and lurches upwards, growing several inches taller from her normal height of two feet tall. You watch with equal parts fascination and fear as she bulges larger again and again and again, reaching human heights in a matter of seconds, stopping when she is exactly six feet tall, which is also your height.

The eagle seems very confused as she looks at you, and she looks down as if to check that her feet were still on the ground. She lets out a loud caw, and uses her wings to envelope you in a hug. You feel her feathers tingle slightly, and she begins to stretch upwards again, though much more slowly this time.

The eagle seems overjoyed with this second wave of growth, and hugs you tighter, cawing softly as you shrink in comparison to her. The eagle reaches seven feet, then eight feet, and lets out a rumble as she spurts up to ten, then twelve feet tall!

The eagle lets out another happy caw, louder and somewhat deeper and more resonant than her previous ones, as you hug and rub her belly. Pressing yourself into her feathery bulk as far as you can go, you openly wonder, "I guess you've become a new ruler of the sky...". The eagle cocks her head cutely, and...
13211212.title: She grows to human height, then to twelve feet ...

choices: Refrain, and see if she shrinks back down after a few seconds
132112121.content:
Original author: Growasaur

"Thank you, little human, thank you!" the eagle speaks, making your jaw drop--and you just witnessed an eagle growing gigantic and hugging you, no less! "I can't tell you how pleased this makes me!"

"Y-you're very...welcome!" you stammer, forcing the words out before you even know what the words are, acting on shocked reflex. Images and old tales suddenly fill your mind, of spirit animals and trickster gods from the days of old. It couldn't be...maybe this was just some insane dream? A wonderful dream, a part of you admits, but still...

She clicks her beak and nuzzles down firmly on you, rubbing the brunt of her feathery head and beak against you and your gear; before she pulls back, you can feel her tingling again, and her newest growth surge puuuusssshes you back, until you fall over; her wings envelope you as fast as you can fall, and she already has you pulled back up into a huge, soft hug, then 18-foot eagle cooing and swelling up all the bigger, her plumed belly bulging out into your body, her wings covering more and more of you as she surges again, up beyond 20 feet, then 25 feet...

"H-how are you getting so big?" you ask, feeling yourself blush heavily.

"Perhaps your affection feeds my growth?" she ponders, and you can't tell if she's just playing with you, or being completely serious. She sounds honest and true. "Let me test this, please," she caws, before sweetly nuzzling you again, and again; you find yourself more than willing to participate, hugging her gigantic body tight; she closes her eyes and spreads her talons in anticipation, as sure enough, she quakes all over, chirping lowly, before lurching up yet again in size, to over 30 whopping feet tall! She's so glorious looking, you just look up in awe from her loving embrace.

"L-looks like it!" you begin, gulping. "But now what?"

She looks back down at you, and somehow you can hear the smile in her gentle voice.

"Please, little one, hug me more! Make me bigger, would you please?"

Whether this is all a freak accident, a dream, or she's a spirit, the thought of her growing up beyond the peaks makes you do the shivering this time...
132112121.title: Talks - she is humanly intelligent!

choices: You and the eagle try and talk peace
You let her try, and roll the dice on how the humans will react
1321121212.content:
Original author: Growasaur

This, you quickly and quietly decide, is definitely a dream. There's no other possible alternative explanation for what's going on; given that it's a dream, you see no harm in indulging her--frankly, you feel it a little indulgent on your part, as well! You smile up at her as she blinks down at you, scooping her huge wings tenderly around you.

"You'll help me, little human?" she cries, her feathers ruffling excitedly up against your body.

"Y-yes, sure I will! Might as well have some fun with my own dream."

"Dream, little one?" she muses, seeming about to laugh. You won't be fooled, though, of course she would say that. You dig into her fluffed feathers, snugging tight as you can on her large body, feeling it breath in and out against you; its so warm, you can't keep from closing your eyes and just enjoying the comfort of it, with or without the growth.

...Though the answer quickly is determined to be "with", as you feel that trademark tingling rippling through her! The eagle cries out louder, somewhere in between victory and juvenile glee, as she expands radically, BOOMING powerfully up and out into the mountain air; smaller birds scatter at her deafening cry, her beak wide open, her pink little growing tongue poking out in joy, as she grows, and grows, and grows, leaping up another 10 feet, then another 17, then another 22, gaining feet more and more rapidly, and in more furious bursts!

"OHHHH," the eagle pants, flapping her wings out wider and wider, "No one has fed me their affections in so long!" She moans, shuddering up even bigger, now standing at an impressive, stunning 75 feet! You open your eyes at this, a moment of panic flashing, before you reassure yourself: that's what a spirit would say, in your dream, after all, she'd be this happy, if not moreso. Heck, by dream logic, things could be much crazier...

She takes off without warning, making you clutch her enormously huge feathers tight as she flies off with you in tow, giving out a strangely un-animal giggle as your tight hold just tickles her.

"Please, hang on! I must take you to my home, little one!" she caws, flapping with so much power that you can hear the trees below warp from the winds they kick up; in minutes she lands heavily on the ground, in a small valley nestled in the upper ranges of the mountains. She politely guides you to the ground with her gigantic wing, where you thud down and shake off the shock of what just happened. For a dream, this feels incredibly real...

You can see a small circle of tents in the mist nearby, with camping equipment all over the place. A hiking party, from the looks of it!

"These humans mean me no harm," she began, pointing with a wing, "but they are right over my nest, and they have been so noisy! No humans come here, I am not used to their presence. I had gone out looking for help in telling them to please go elsewhere, but thanks to your power, I am so big that I can talk to them myself!"

"Then...why did you bring me along?" you ask, dusting yourself off.

"In case they say no, my little friend," she chirps. Good gravy, you think...are you here to give her more size, if they fight back? It wouldn't come to that, right??
1321121212.title: HUG her--HUUUUUUUG HERRRRR!!!!

choices: "Get out of dodge--but we're coming back with cameras!"
"Call our own spirit of the earth--yeah, we have one!"
13211212121.content:
Original author: Growasaur

Boy, your dream's getting really involved, you think to yourself. Best to just go along, though.

"Okay," you say, "rock and roll, let's go talk to them."

"We'll rock rocks at them?" the now-gigantic eagle asks, clicking her big beak in confusion.

"We'll...er, nevermind, no, we'll just talk."

She cocks her head, blinking at you, before nodding, thumping right behind you as you both wander within ear-and-eyeshot of the encampment, the sound of heavy metal blaring from a nearby boombox. An RV can now be seen near a stream, behind the circle of tents and folding chairs. Ooh, they even have a nice portable hibachi grill thing! Er, focus, you think, strolling up rather boldly into the circle.

"Anybody home?" you shout over the din, looking between tents for activity. Two of them unzip pretty quickly, and four humans total those who respond, as they stand there in the circle's center, blinking in a daze of sorts. Beer cans are everywhere. They may well be drunk, and that might well work to your advantage...

"Who're you, man?" one bearded hiker asks, not really aggressively, but genuinely curious. His voice is slurred.

"I, uh...am here on behalf of the spirit of the skies?" you begin, seeing what their reaction is. They just stare on. "You know, the sky...the spirit, it's of the sky? Big honking eagle? Because, you know, she's right behind me..."

You motion back to her, and she smiles down at them, chirping softly.

"Hello!" she says, pretty plainly. She ruffles her feathers reassuringly at them.

"That's...a big eagle!" one girl laughs, before the other three bend over with her, caught in hysterics of a fittingly grand scale. They quickly double over laughing, falling over one another. "How much dust does the sky accumulate over the weekend?" another girl asks, making them all laugh harder. "Where's the maid of the mountains, dude? Is that her feather duster? 'Cause we got all these cans, and...oh god, I can't even finish, haha!" They cackle like tipsy hyenas in mountain face gear, and even in a dream, you feel a hot blush of embarrassment forming. "I'm so blitzed, man, it's not even..."

"You humans are making so much noise," she gently cawed, defluffing her plumage some. "Couldn't I ask you to please move elsewhere? M-my nest, it's right over in this tree..." She motions up to, then realizes she's enormous now, and actually has to look down at the tree, to find her nest is littered with beer cans and smokes.

You're too small and down to the ground to tell what she's seeing, but the look on her face isn't good.

"Guys, you...seriously, you should leave. A lot," you begin, before she takes you up in her feathers, rubbing you all over herself, spreading your arms and pressing you into her in a big, long hug. She begins to quiver all over, curling her talons in tight, as she's done asking nicely, and is ready to grow.

"HUMANS!" she bellows, fluffing up bigger and bigger, losing you in her fluff; it's...actually still just as nice as before, if not moreso--naturally, she's going to scare the fire out of them, but this is, well...sooo niiiice... "DEPART FROM MY HOME, I--er, THE SPIRIT OF THE SKIES DEMANDS YOU VACATE!"

"V-vacate?" one of the guys asks, all four of them losing their humor, and backing away steadily as she swells larger and larger still, towering higher, up to 90 feet, then 100, then 120, then 150, more than double her previous size, letting you hang in her feathers and keep hugging as she flapflaps her huge wings imposingly.

"IT MEANS LEAVE!!"she blasts, flapping so hard that their tents all go flying, uprooted from their stakes, the RV jittering along the ground as she swells larger still, puffing herself up demandingly.

One of the guys looks to the rest, and they huddle, getting over their drunkenness pretty fast as the pow-wow. After a moment of this the eagle has stopped growing, nearly 200 whopping feet tall! She starts smiling some as you rub into her, but puts her game face back on as they turn to look up, up and up at her.

"O-okay, miss eagle-sky-demon, we've decided to..."
13211212121.title: You and the eagle try and talk peace

choices: Drops a little bit in, destroying the orb and releasing the spirit of the earth.
Dumps it in, making the orb and spirit grow much, much larger than the eagle.
132112121212.content:
Original author: Infinity421

"We've decided to call our own spirit of the earth--yeah, we have one!" The leader of the group calls out defiantly to the two hundred foot tall avian, who is now smirking at them. She lowers the volume of her voice and announces, clearly, "The spirit of the skies would like to see your attempt." Causing the leader of the group to realise his bluff had been exposed.

However, you sight a member of the group near the back, wearing pure black hoodie and trousers, with strange tattoos on his face, who has backed away from the group. He begins silently muttering and pulls a small cloth pouch from his pockets, before turning back to the eagle, who has now noticed him, and yells in his loudest voice, "I ACCEPT YOUR CHALLENGE, MISTRESS OF THE SKIES!", slightly stunning the eagle and scaring the heck out of his intoxicated friends, as he reaches inside the pouch and withdraws a small amount of fine red powder, which he throws onto the floor as it ignites.

The small fire quickly morphs and expands into a ball of blinding light, roughly eight feet across, and you see a large, dark shape moving within. Despite the intimidating display, you can sense a sort of aura coming from within, and it holds no malice, only gentleness and kindness, similarly to the eagle.

By now the man's friends are slowly edging away from both him and the eagle, looking for a way out of the situation, but finding none. The man looks dissatisfied with the orb, and removes some more powder and throws it into the white sphere, prompting it to ripple outwards and expand, stopping at fifty feet tall, with the dark shape being a lot larger.

The man seems torn over something, and has a discussion inside his head. He takes the pouch containing the powder, and...
132112121212.title: "Call our own spirit of the earth--yeah, we...

choices: A female dinosaur of some kind.
A female dog of some kind.
1321121212122.content:
Original author: Infinity421

The man still seems unsatisfied, however, and takes hold of his pouch once again, noting the level of powder inside it, before casting the entire thing into the orb, causing it to ripple and turn a light orange colour, finally satisfying the man. The orb begins to steadily swell, doubling in height once, twice, and then again, all the way up to four hundred feet, before lurching another hundred feet larger, and suddenly bursting all the way up to one thousand feet tall, the eagle gulping in fear at the though of having to potentially fight something so much larger than her.

But the orb is not done growing, yet, and continues to pump higher into the sky, as it reaches two thousand feet, then three thousand feet, and then grows all the way up to a mile in height, and begins to ripple yet again, before smashing into the mountainsides as its growth continues to power it up and up until it reaches a stupendous five miles in height, and shatters to reveal the dark shape inside is...
1321121212122.title: Dumps it in, making the orb and spirit grow muc...

choices: You feed her up until she can fight back!
You overdo it, and the eagle looms over even the allosaurus!!!
13211212121221.content:
Original author: Growasaur

The orb has grown so much! A blinding flash covers the area, the light getting ridiculously bright, and you, the eagle, the others campers and their overzealous friend all cover your eyes as best as possible.

"Dave, what did you do!?" one girl asks, feeling around uselessly in the air.
"Holy cow, it worked!" Dave says in reply. "This stuff works!!"
"I thought it was just Paprika," the other girl adds, sheepishly.
"That shaman back at the station wouldn't just sell me Paprika, Bev," Dave shoots back.
"WHAT HAVE YOU UNLEASHED?" the gigantic eagle asks, cutting them off. As if in answer, the light fades at last, leaving all blinking eyes to adjust to the sight of an enormous allosaurus looming over not just them, but the canopy, the mountaintops, and even most of the mountains! Its massive feet clutch reflexively at the base of the mountain range, its colossal head looking this way and that far, far up in the atmosphere, peeking through even the lower cloud cover.

"I...am free?" the gargantuan dinosaur asks no one, with a deep, powerful, yet feminine voice. She peers down at the cluster of tinies far, far below, cocking her head. "Whom among you summoned me here? And..."she felt herself over, her reptilian eyes widening in serious surprise, "how hard did you call me!?" Her tail swiiiiiiishes luxuriously overhead, slicing the cloud banks swirling around her huge body.

"We did!" Dave says, though she has to lean way, way down to hear properly. The visual effect is like having a scaly meteor come crashing down towards them, and all but Dave run off, for whatever good that would have done. Even the eagle is stepping fairly far back. "We have this party crasher eagle over here, saying she wants us to leave!"

The enormous dinosaur sniffs around, then locates the eagle.

"Is this true, fellow spirit?" she booms.

"It is my home!" the giant avian replies, giving her wings a defensive shrug. "I have been here long uninterrupted, and have only found my old powers back this very day! I don't wish at all to fight you, fellow spirit! I suspect you have been without powers for much longer, surely you can understand..."

"Oh, that is so true!" she replies, nodding her head sympathetically, the motion alone shifting the air around them all. "I have been without since that incident back when my kind walked the world over! But..." she gulps, still embarrassed, in spite of being 5 massive miles tall. "...You know as well as I do that we spirits are bound by summoning laws! I must do as I am bid!"

"Yeah, atta girl!" Dave shouts, making the allosaurus sigh heavily, shaking the earth around them. Countless years away form the corporeal realm, and this was day one back. Ugh.

"Very well," the eagle says, clutching you back up in her wings. Until just then, you were doing a good job of hiding behind her, but the downside was you were in wing's grasp; now she rubs you up and down hard against herself, her feathers ruffling all over as power starts to build inside of her.

"What're you--" you begin.

"Please, love me!" she begs, starting to ripple and tingle all over, her body lurching taller as she goes on, her feathers spreading adorable around you. In spite of the situation, she's even cuter than before! "You must make me BIG! Bigger than even her! I must protect me home!"
13211212121221.title: A female dinosaur of some kind.

132112121212211.content:
Original author: Growasaur

Before you know it, the eagle is starting to huff openly, her beak staying open as the tingling grows worse and worse and worse within her feathery body; in seconds she's pouring out bigger, inflating faster and faster over the entire campsite, her feathered tail pushing under and scooping the campers' RV up, then off its wheels, flipping it easily with a loud crash, though the sound is promptly muffled under her expanding plumed rear; her growing talons dig into the mountain, trees bending and warping in protest as she expands up beyond 300 feet, then 400, her growth escalating as she just keeps rubbing you deeper into herself, panting aloud in a mixture of necessity and what seems to be a hint of powerlust...which, honestly, you can't keep from liking a little. Just a bit!

"More!" she caws, taking moments here and there to glance up nervously at the stupendously big dinosaur looming over her still--and, well, everything, at her fantastically overdone size; the female lizard just watched, herself somewhat curious as to how far this insanity she's been pulled into can wind up going. Her enormously huge foot raises up over the 700-foot eagle, and hovers there imposingly.

"Please, fellow spirit, don't give me cause to follow through," the allosaur says, with genuine concern.
"I must defend what is mine!" the eagle replies, before crying out, trembling all over, and ruffle-ballooning up to over 1,200 feet, then exploding more furiously than even she anticipated, her eyes widening as she inflates all over, her chest and neck swelling and bulging out as the size floods her rudely, leaving her towering herself at a good mile in size! She defiantly sits on everyone below, not harming the campers at all, but trapping them under-rump like teeny eggs; indeed, the entire valley under her is now a perfect fit for her coverage, turning that segment of the entire mountaintop into her nest.

"How strange," the allosaur says, a slow smile spreading on her muzzle way up above. "I was just about to get to doing my summoner's bidding, when lo and behold, I can't hear anything from him anymore! I am bound to him by law, though, so I must put my foot down..."

The eagle smiles back, though she shows a moment's panic once the dinosaur actually makes good on her statement, and lets the heavy, humongous digit come crashing down; however, it merely touches softly on the eagle's head, and begins to stroke it over sweetly, leaving the 1.3-mile tall eagle blinking in surprise, before lidding her eyes in pleasure, warbling happily at all the attention.

"Oh, but it appears you've gotten so big that my attempts to stop you just aren't working," the dino says with a feminine chuckle, petting the happy mega-eagle slowly and tenderly. Down under her rump, the campers all wriggle and protest, but the orders to try harming the eagle just can't be heard anymore. The eagle caws softly, feeling you hug her, feeling love from the enormous reptile overhead as well, and she begins to tremble even more than ever before, her fluffed body bursting warmly to over 2 miles, then 3, then 4, looming up higher and wider as all the affection soaks her swelling form deeply, pouring into her and feeding her up to 5 miles, totally even with the massive dinosaur; she bumps her muzzle to her beak cutely, and the eagle nuzzles hard into her in thanks.

"You saved me!" the eagle cries gleefully, though you can tell she blushes when you chip in:
"I helped, too!"
"Oh, you certainly did, yes! Thank you little friend, thank you so much!!" she chirps and clicks her humongous beak in joy, preening you with her feathers in appreciation. As she does so, the tingling returns, full-force, and she begins to widen her eyes yet again, as she can feel her sides blowing up against the tips and spires of the entire mountain range, her growth truly taking off, pushing back even the dinosaur, who just laughs in amusement, and hugs into her growing body tight, as she swells and bulges to over...
132112121212211.title: You can Grow Higher than an Eagle...

choices: "I'd like to...speak with the humans you're sitting on. Mind getting up?"
"I'm thinking of...visiting a nearby human city. Want to come with me?" :3
1321121212122111.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

The eagle continues to skyrocket in size, laughing all the while. Despite the sheer insanity of the whole thing, you can't help but join in. This whole day has been a roller coaster--talking eagles, magic spirits, gigantic creatures that actually get bigger, just by giving hugs--forget hiking, THIS is how you spend a weekend!

Plus, seeing your new avian friend pin the arrogant campers under her rear was pretty funny. Guess they got a...bum deal out of all this, you think--and suddenly find that the eagle has stopped growing. Maybe bad puns stop it, or...

The eagle's laughter finally subsides as she catches her breath. Then you hear her let out an adorable squawk. "Oh... oh dear. I think I overdid it that time."
Her voice had a faint echo--not a surprise in a mountain range, but it sounded like it was coming from...below? Cocking your head, you wriggle loose of the eagle's embrace to look out at the landscape...

And then your jaw drops open, and your eyes bug out in a way that--had you looked in a mirror--would have reminded you of Loony Toons.

It was like looking at a map, really. The mountains seemed little more than gray ridges coming out of the ground, topped with white. The sprawling meadows and plains of the countryside stretched out into the distance--like a natural tapestry, a patchwork rug of green. (You were usually better with metaphors, but THIS is really out of your linguistic league). Wispy clouds dot the sky; many look level with the eagle, or like they'd be below her chest if closer. Off in the far distance, you can see the distinctive grey and brown of a city.

That, and you're pretty sure you can see the curvature of the Earth on the horizon. That's impressive too.

"How the... wha.. How big are you now, anyway?!?" You blurt out, feeling utterly gobsmacked. "I can see for miles...literally!"

The eagle chuckles nervously. "I think..that's because I'm miles tall. Ten miles to be exact."

You blink slowly. Ten miles tall? She was the size of a small town!
After a long, awkward pause, you find your voice. "So...now what?"

Below, you hear the allosaur clear her throat--loud enough to be heard, but still polite. "Well, I suppose that settles the 'who wins' issue," she announces, starting to grow. In a few moments, she's level with the eagle--though she's on another mountain altogether, to give the bird some personal space. "As for the human's question, well..."
1321121212122111.title: Where (Giant) Eagles Dare

choices: The eagle/allosaur ends up being the bigger one!
They both grow equally TREMENDOUS in size, overfed by humans!!
13211212121221112.content:
Original author: Growasaur

"Having never been in this severe a situation," the dinosaur explains calmly, swishing her vast tail thoughtfully, "I can only assume that we will dwindle back down eventually--but I'm currently overflowing with power, and clearly so are you," she giggles, bumping muzzle to beak with the massively huge, blushing eagle. At least, you imagine she's blushing, as there's a prominent flare-up of body heat from her, her feathers bobbing up and down cutely against you as she coos and ruffles them a little. "While I do not at all mind being this big and powerful, truth be told, it is clear now that anyone else that can hold sway over our actions would be all the more tempted to do so, given how strong you and I have grown, kin eagle."

"What are you proposing?" the eagle chirps, cocking her huge head.

"We go and tell the humans ourselves not to abuse our powers, or THIS happens. There's one of their communes just across the way. We should put on a little show, to dissuade them from further harassment."

"Oh, but I don't want to hurt anyone," the gargantuan avain says, putting her massive wingtips together as thought they were fingers.

"Oh no, kin eagle," the allosaur laughs, with a feminine giggle, "I mean only to loom overhead and impose a nonviolent ultimatum. Should they fear us too much, after all, they might strike, and we are not meant to escalate things any further. But we really ought to act, nonetheless."

With that she turns all of her 10-mile bulk slowly around, smiling back at the massive spirit eagle, then motioning for her to follow along as she stomps down off the valley (though by 'off', at that size, it really means a few comparative little inches). Her foot slams the earth with a muffled, meteoric impact, shockwaves rolling out for half a mile under her heavy reptilian soles; her tail tickles and brushes the eagle's feathery chest, making her chuckle and nip the tailtip harmlessly; playfully, she spreads her humongously wide wings open, and waits, the dinosaur dragged her along, before the titanic reptile looks back in confusion.

"Sorry," the eagle speaks, letting her tail drop from her beak, "I have seen the humans sailing behind their vehicles as though flying, and I couldn't resist trying..."

"I am going to like being in your company, kin eagle," the monstrously huge allosaur laughs. "Why don't you adopt that same pose when you reach the--oh, we're here."

Indeed, they are, already looming high, high, HIIIIGH up over the tops of the paper-thin skyscrapers of the city, really more a few sheets of paper stacked so as to differentiate themselves in some laughably minute way from the rest of the surface of the world. Two pairs of fantastically big dino feet and mutually huge eagle talons loom over everything, clawtips clicking up and down over hills and smaller mountains, vibrations cascading through the city, setting off all manner of car alarms and screams as their presence is noted en masse.

"Attention, little humans!" the allosaur booms authoritatively, "we are great spirits of nature, spanning time immortal, standing over the very earth we represent! We mean you no severe harm, but we come with a grave warning: our power has been abused by humans, and our current size is the result of such foolishness and recklessness! We come now to warn you, do not involve us in your petty affairs again, and hence-on, you shall respect he bounds of nature!"

"Do you think they'll listen?" the eagle asks you quietly, blinking her huge, adorable eyes; granted, she's squinting to find you...

"I don't think it'll go that smooth, just yet..." you yell up to her, a best you can, pointing her towards what you can more easily see: an entire airborne squadron is pummeling away at both the eagle and the dinosaur, neither of the titans noticing at all as missiles slam uselessly into their bodies, the explosions not even big enough to be seen or felt.

"Sister allosaur," the eagle says, poking her backside with a wing, "our little humans friend says they are not complying! Wh...what do we do now? I will not harm them, but they're calling our bluff!"

"Not to worry, eagle," the allosaur says, simply puffing some air out of her nostrils, sending the heavy artillery scattering all over like panicked little gnats. As she chuckles, the allosaur feels the feathers of the eagle puffing out against her backside, then her eyes widen as she realizes her chest is now, more-than covering it, the upwards curve of the avian's mighty body sliding up slowly over her scales, her head getting mooshed down by a growing field of plumage. With a booming, echoing chirp, she and everyone around sees the eagle growing even bigger!

"Wh-what?" the eagle cries, surging up another 1,000 feet, then another after that, her eyes fluttering in bliss. "I...I feel love radiating from the city!" With that, the allosaur feels herself tingling all over, starting to boom up even bigger as well, the two giantesses getting cutely, awkwardly tangled together, as they grow and grow and grow, rising even higher up over the sky-view of the littles down below. "I don't know h-how, but I can feel them loving us! Millions o-of themmmm!"

Neither one realizes the entire thing had been televised worldwide, and some serious love and admiration was being loosed the world over...
13211212121221112.title: "I'm thinking of...visiting a nearby hu...

choices: The two spirits have some fun with the city! :3
Hold on...what happened to those hikers back at the mountain? (Scene Change!)
132112121212211121.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

"I appreciate the affection, and towering over the humans is nice...but this is just ridiculous!" the allosaur-spirit cries out as she and the eagle magnify once more. "If this continues, we'll hit our heads on the moon!" She sighs and shakes her head as both creatures grow past the cloud cover, soaring into the upper atmosphere. Thankfully, the growth tapers off soon after that...without either spirit-creature reaching space, or at least without hitting their head on the moon.

"Is...is it over?" The eagle asks nervously, looking around. "I don't even want to know how big...we...are-- oh my..."

"Oh My" indeed. Both creatures had reached truly gargantuan sizes--the city below seemed a mass of grey, with individual buildings almost indistinguishable. This time, you were sure you could see the curvature of the Earth--and that the shadows of both spirits stretched for what had to be dozens of miles, blanketing huge swaths of the area in shade...even the mountains off in the distance, where all this had started, were covered....by the eagle's shadow, meaning she had ended up the biggest.

"Well...I guess that should send a message," you offer, stunned for the umpteenth time today. Then, a thought occurs. "Hey wait a minute: what about the city?!? Just your feet, er, talons growing forward could have toppled half of it! But...it looks fine!" You look down at the city below, and lo and behold, not a single building looked damaged in the slightest despite both spirits' feet--especially the eagle's talons--jutting into them as they had grown. In fact....it almost looks likethe buildings...moved to accommodate them as they grew! "But...how...why...?" You splutter.

"I believe I can answer that, little human." The allosaur's voice calls out. She actually wasn't that mush shorter than the eagle, coming up to the colossal avian's chest. "As spirits of the earth and sky, we are sworn to protect our realms from outside threats. But as you've seen today, we can reach....considerable sizes and strengths given the right circumstances. Just one of us could become large and powerful enough to, as the saying goes, 'take over the world' and rule it themselves. And two spirits at such sizes? Well, you probably have an idea of how THAT could go wrong. So, we have a check on our power: no matter how big we get, we can never harm anyone unless they pose a direct threat. That's why those annoying hikers weren't squished when your eagle friend sat on them."

The eagle giggles, a bit sheepishly. "I admit, I kind of enjoyed that..."

You mull it over. "So...that's why the buildings...moved?"

The eagles reaches her head down and nuzzles you, chirping cutely. "That's about right, little guy!" she coos.

The allosaur chuckles at the affectionate display. "And that's also why you can still breathe despite being at such an altitude, little human. But with that out of the way, I suppose you wouldn't mind if we...messed around with these humans for a bit? It's been a while since I've been to a human city, let alone this large."

The eagle nods rapidly, smiling hugely. "Oh, yes! Please don't worry, we wont hurt anyone--we can't hurt anyone, promise! Besides, you humans are just too cute!"

You shrug...then smirk. "Of course you can. This'll be fun to watch, and I've got a front-row seat! Have at it, ladies!"
Yeah, THIS was turning out to be a fun day.
132112121212211121.title: The Eagle Goddess Revolution Will Be Televised!

1321121212122111212.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Dave was... Annoyed, for a lack of harsh language. Annoyed at the Spirit of the Earth. and annoyed at the Spirit of the Sky. Although, he had to admit, the colossal, fifty... Sixty? Sixty five mile tall eagle was pretty cute. The other campers had fled after the allosaurus and eagle had moved away, but Dave had stayed.

Dave looked up at the sun, before the growing eagle blocked it out with her eighty five mile tall feathery bulk. No, not yet. What form would the Spirit of the sun take, anyway? The only possibility dave saw was a Phoenix.

Dave checked the pockets he had put into the inside of his hoodie when he ordered it. It truly was an effort to block out the titanic Spirits' voices, but what he heard was to interesting to ignore. They literally couldn't harm people? Dave blushed slightly when the eagle mentioned sitting on him and his friends. That had felt kind of good, as the eagle's feather were so unbelievably soft.

Dave retrieved four pouches of powder from the inside pockets of his hoodie, opening them to check the contents. A light cyan blue powder in the first, a blazing yellow-orange in the second, and pure black in the third, and black mixed with silver in the last. He had to wonder what the last two were. Spirits of the Cosmos? If the Spirits truly were gentle, as the Allosaurus had said, what was the harm in summoning a few more?

Placing all but the pouch of cyan powder back into his pockets, dave removed a small pinch of the powder, holding it between his fingers. The Spirit of the sea was, according to his research, legendarily playful, often growing to massive sizes just to have more fun, and to hug more and more people. Truth be told, though, he honestly hasn't expected the powders to work. He expected a ritual would have been required. The ancient times he had used also neglected to mention what would happen if a powder was applied directly to its appropriate Spirit.

Grinning, Dave threw the small amount of powder onto the ground, watching it catch on fire, before expanding into a deep blue orb ten feet across. Dave would save his powder, then dump it all on the Spirit. Whatever happened, it couldn't make things worse.

The orb expanded on its own, stopping at twenty feet in diameter, before exploding to reveal...
1321121212122111212.title: The Spirit of The Sea

choices: They go catch up with Dave's friends.
They're off to the city...and the Eagle and Allosaur!
13211212121221112121.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

Floating before Dave was, of all things, a dolphin of about twenty feet in size. Odd, he expected the Spirit of the Seas to be a giant squid or something. Oh well, a summoning is a summoning, Dave thought with a shrug. Who was he to question what forms Spirits took?

"So, you're the one who summoned me, right?" The dolphin asked cheerfully, "swimming" through the air towards Dave. The voice was feminine, and sounded younger than the other two creatures'. Her movements were also quicker; graceful but twitchy...like an overly-happy kid.
Odd that every Spirit so far has been female...ah, whatever. Dave shook his head; he had to focus.

"Yes, that's me, Spirit of the Seas," Dave intoned, putting on an authoritative air. He wasn't the best actor around, but he figured first impressions would be vital. After all, the last time he'd summoned a Spirit and not taken charge, a certain spectral dinosaur had simply stood by while he and his friends had been pinned under a certain spectral eagle's feathery rump. He wasn't too keen on something like that happening again. "My name is Dave, and I am your summoner. Tell me, what do you know of the Spirits of the Earth and Sky?" After a moment's hesitation, he loosely crossed his arms and straightened his posture--best to play the part in full, after all.

The Dolphin-Spirit rolled in the air, looking Dave over. "Pleased to meet you, boss," she chirped. "As for the other Spirits...well, they're a lot of fun! Sky is always looking for a hug, and she's always found you humans adorable. And she just loves mountains--like this one, actually!--always making a nest or two on some peak, usually watching over any villages or towns nearby." The Sea-Spirit "swam" around Dave as she kept talking; "And...well, she likes humans, but she has this odd habit when they annoy her or make her mad..."

Dave had to suppress a chuckle, he just knew what was coming.

"...She likes to, well, pin them somehow to shut them up," the dolphin concluded, giggling. "I've seen her just lie down on some guys with axes, pinning them under her belly; Once she stepped on a trireme to keep it from leaving a dock when the humans had chopped up her favorite forest to make the ship, and--"

"Sit on some hikers for annoying her?" Dave added, smirking.

The dolphin-spirit blinked...then laughed. It was an odd--yet adorable--laugh, a mix of a human-sounding chortle and the squeaky chirps of the creature she took the form of. "Wha-what??" She choked out between laughs, "That's...hilarious! When did that happen, and who were the poor saps she did that to?"

Dave simply smiled. "Those 'poor saps' were me and my friends, and it happened just this morning."

The dolphin winced, halting her mid-air "swim". "Oh...sorry, boss," she squeaked. "...Anyway, Earth acts more...grown-up than Sky; she likes humans too, but she doesn't go around looking for hugs and cuddling them every chance she gets. Actually, she sorta likes messing around with you guys, she's pretended to be a big monster and scared up humans before; she especially likes human cities for some reason...why'd you ask, boss?"

Dave smiled, and pointed behind the Sea-Spirit. The dolphin turned around...and her jaw dropped as she saw the other two Spirits, grown to ludicrous sizes, and lazily lying around near a nearby city, idly chatting away while a crowd of people swarmed around them. They were leaving, breathing mountains of feathers and scales.

"...How did I not notice that until now?" The dolphin squeaked, dumbstruck.

"Don't worry about it," Dave soothed, hugging the dolphin. There was a sensation like static electricity cracking all over her, and the feeling of the aquatic spirit inflating and pushing him back. By the time Dave let her go, the dolphin was easily 70 feet long. "Now then, we have somewhere to be..."
13211212121221112121.title: Summoning, Take Two

choices: The Moon spirit, already influenced, feeds the eagle to cosmic sizes!!!!
The Core Spirit attempts to absorb the eagle's incoming growth spurt!
1321121212122112.content:
Original author: Growasaur

"Ha...haaaaaah," the eagle caws, digging her ultra-thick talons deep into the ground; she shears the dirt and grass and rock, crushing or nudging once-mighty boulders aside with zero effort. Said talons and toes swell loudly, aggressively, the scales to her huge feet stretching ominously.

"What is it?" the earth spirit asks, cocking her reptilian head curiously at her cousin. "Are you alright, dear kin?" The allosaur nuzzles harder, and harder, and harder, awash in genuine concern--but the eagle only moans and shakes harder, the more she's nuzzled on.

"I...B-B...BI..." the colossal, mountain-sized avian breathes, gulping and cawing in bliss. The tingling worsens! The ground starts to quiver and quake, pebbles, trees, far-off campers, cars and boulders all starting to jitter about fearfully. Her huge eyes close as she opens her beak wider, and wider, and...

"AAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHH!!"

With a flustering rush of fluffed-up feathers, a vast, snuggly wall booms into you--into everything down below, even--as the sweet-hearted eagle cries out and BOOMS another 30 miles in size, in one blasting burst of growth!! You ride the wave, along with the colossal dinosaur, as the sheer cliff of the eagle's chest pushes you both out further and further over the mountain range. Her rear pushes down over the entire span effortlessly, feathers puffing out in shock, as she goes from 10 to 20, then to fifteen, then the full 30, then comes to a rest. Her head bobbles as she sighs, still shivering a little.

"AH, so good! So gooood!" the eagle quake-chirps, beaming happily. Her voice echoes for mile after mile, shaking the snow off of the far-flung mountains in the distance.

"Incredible!" the alloasaur moons, blinking her gigantic eyes. She nuzzles into her feathers like crazy. "Hmmmnmph...fellow kin, your feathers are so soft! I just...can't...help..." She nuzzles more and more and more, making the eagle catch her breath.

"G...good! Please...give m-me more, fellow spirit! Please...Make...ME...GROOOOOW!"

Something is strange here--er, more so. The eagle feels just as kind and warm, sure, but the alloausar, while talking the same way, is becoming more and more...enamored of the eagle...

"Yes, of course, dear one! Feed! GROW!"

The eagle begins to rumble and rattle, shaking so much that the tectonic plates wobble about just a tiny bit. The clouds swirling about her feathery midsection shift and move about, as the power builds and builds within the swollen avian...it just gets deeper and deeper...

"Uh," you begin, so very lost among feathers the size of your neighborhood street, "you look amazing, eagle, but...I dunno, isn't this a bit much?"

"Ohhhh, mooooore! MOOOOORE! MMMMOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO--"

The eagle roars, erupting five times larger, in one awesome spurt of power...

"--OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO--"

150 miles booms to 250...460...600!!!

"OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORE!!!!!"

You hear the oddest noises, and after some climbing up a skyscraper-sized feather, you see other spirits rising from the world; most are only so big, but they are large enough to be seen climbing up around you, on her groaning body.

"Kin...let us love you, too..." a massive horse says, imploringly.

"Let us cuddle you!" a gigantic female dolphin begs, nuzzling into her form.

"It's like her powers got too big, all of a sudden," you muse, as you observe the curvature of the very planet itself, seemingly safe at your vantage. "But this means...holy cow, she's gonna get HUGE!"

"MOOOOOREMOOOOOREMOOOOOREMOOOOOOORE! YES!!" the giddy eagle booms, clicking her huge, huge beak in joy. "PLEASE! LOVE ME!! LOVE ME MORE, ALL OF YOOOOU! MAKE ME EVEN LARGER! I WANT TO GROW AND GROOOOOOOW!! I LOVE YOU ALL SO MUCH!"

...Huh. Maybe this was why the spirits never were given too much at once.

The same rumble tears through the monstrously vast eagle yet again, and she begins to openly pant and tremble, fluffing herself up in gleeful anticipation. The planet goes quiet, the nearest cities and far-away countries--even the cities covered by her harmless fluffy rear--all wait and watch in shock, as the rumbling gets heavier and louder.

"NNNNNNN..."

Her beak shuts as she grows more tense...

"HNNNNNNNNNGHHHHH...HAAAAH...HAAAAAAAAAAAAHHH!"

Visible tics pulse through her, as her feathers begin to grow a golden shade, shimmering with energy. Waves of power flood off of her, only to be pulled back in, making the many forests below do the wave, in and out, as she keeps soaking up more love, more than she knows what to do with! Gads, the shaking--it's getting so much worse!!

"HHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!"

Despite her cries, her beak is open in a huge, glorious smile--she's never sounded so happy! Just before the spurt erupts from within her, a great and booming voice calls out:

"WHAT IS ALL THIS COMMOTION!?"

You hang on dearly to a feather-tip, and look out to see a great bronze dragoness, easily half the size of the planet, coming up from the crust as though she were part-ghost. You and the other spirits are agog...but the eagle is nearly screaming with need, her body pulsing violently, her breathing fast and deep as she smiles.

"AGAIN, I SAY--WHAT IS THIS NONSENSE!?" the dragoness booms.

"Core spirit!" a massive python hisses, nodding in respect. "Hello!! It's eagle, look at her! Isn't she radiant? She's grown so big and beautiful! We can't resist loving her!"

The eagle tries to speak, but blushes, and begins to uncontrollably strettttch out with growth...

"AH, SHE IS GORGEOUS, IS SHE NOT, FRIEND CORE SPIRIT?" a new feminine voice asks. You look up and up and up and up, to see a silver dragoness, though not as huge as the core one. She purrs, sticking partly out of the moon, making sweet eyes at the less-humongous eagle.

"MY DEAR MOON SPIRIT, PLEASE. DO NOT BE INFLUENCED BY HER GROWING POWER SO EASILY."

The eagle groans and bursts a bit more, trying so hard to hold back, as more and more affection pours freely into her quaking body...she can't contain it anymore!!

Her roar splits the heavens, as the eagle balloons at an incredible pace, 600 miles lurching disproportionately up to 800, then bulging on the other side as she roars past 1,100 miles, then 1,500!! She just gets bigger and bigger, the thin sheet of clouds below rocking out further and further, as her puffing plumage sweeps them away!

"GOODNESS!" the Core dragoness roars, as the eagle bumps and swells right into her, pushing happily and so warmly into the colossal dragon. "STOP THIS RIGHT NOW, EAGLE!"

"I CAAAAAAN'T!" she giggles, blowing up three times larger!

Her avian shadow consumes the land, casting the hemisphere in gentle darkness, as she pants and grunts, and doubles her size!!! The planet itself, while still larger, becomes more and more like some too-big egg atop which the growing female is perched! And still she shudders with growth!!!!
1321121212122112.title: BIGGER!!

choices: Eagle grows as big as the Milky Way!!
13211212121221121.content:
Original author: Growasaur

9,000 miles. Your new friend the eagle...she had gone from regular sized to over 47,500,000 feet, in this short, bizarre time. Put a massive bronze staff into the south pole, and you could have made a pretty nice flagstand...in space.

"Oh, that's better! So much better!" the eagle giggles, fluffing up joyfully. She finally peers down, then gawks. "Oh my! I'm...I really DID get bigger!" A feather as big as a lesser archipelago floats down, crashing into the ocean, rocking ships with no real harm for miles over.She blinks, batting her gigantic, deep eyes, and can't help but smile. She blushes and shudders more, as every spirit on Earth loves continually on her figure. "Mmmmn..."

"ENOUGH OF THIS, NOW, EAGLE! SERIOUSLY!" the angry core spirit huffs. The only slightly-bigger dragoness furrows her brows and cocks her head, restraining obvious envy as she glances the gargantuan eagle over. "YOU MUST REALIZE, DEAR EAGLE...THIS IS FAR TOO SEVERE OF AN IMBALANCE. PLEASE, DO RELINQUISH YOUR SIZE, RIGHT NOW."

"H-how, core spirit?" she chirps, genuinely curious.

"NOW, NOW, FRIEND SPIRIT, GO EASY ON HER," the huge silver moon-spirit says, smiling wide. "SHE IS WORTHY OF SUCH SHE HAS RECEIVED, I DO THINK. LET HER JOIN OUR ECHELON OF STATURE."

"ABSOLUTELY NOT! YOU AND I BALANCE OUT THIS AREA OF THE COSMOS, NOT HER. SHE IS A SUBORDINATE. A LOVELY ONE, EAGLE, DO NOT MISUNDERSTAND."

"Oh, th-thank you so much!" Eagle coos, putting her colossal wings up to her beak in sweet embarrassment at the compliment. "To have you of all the spirits say so...I...IIIII..."

The shudder grows and grows within her, and the bronze dragoness cocks a brow nervously. Everything not nailed down trembles on earth. A second more, and the pulsing quake swells, rattling the unharmed world. Everywhere her great, vast claws dig in, there is only open land or waters. To those living, it's like some god has slipped a few quarters into a message bed.

"N-NOW, EAGLE, THAT IS ENOUGH..."

"H...HAAAAH...AAAAAAAAAH!!!"

Her golden feathers fluff further out, as if pleading with the stern spirit to let their master grow and grow. The only thing that comes from the great dragoness, however, is a set of slack jaws, as the gentle silver dragoness emerges fully from the moon and cuddles the larger eagle tenderly against herself, smiling.

"YOU'RE JUST...SO GORGEOUS..." the less-gigantic (but still immense) dragoness purrs, nuzzling hard into the eagle's soft belly.

"M-moon spirit..." the eagle rumbles, lidding her adorable eyes low. The vibrations grow much, much stronger, emanating from the colossal avian in great, rolling waves of affection-soaked energy.

"HAVE YOU GONE MAD, FELLOW DRAGON!?" the core spirit balks, starting to pointlessly back away. "S-STOP, MOON! EVEN THE LOWER SPIRITS HAVE MADE EAGLE THIS B-BIG, DON'T--"

"HHHHHHHHHH...HHHHAAAAAAHHHHHHHAAAAAAAAAAA!"

The eagle's quaking goes from violent to outright catastrophic as she closes her eyes, beams wildly, and lets her beak hang open. The roar that follows is so large that the world can see her swell out as it passed through her throat, and out into the heavens:

BBBBBBIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGGGGGGGG GGGGGGGERRRRRR!!!!!

The great body of the silvery moon spirit almost vanishes into a forest of plumed chaos, as the eagle blows up furiously, audibly stretching and swelling, pumping and groaning, her body rocketing out in every direction in a mess of pleasured growth. Her thickening neck creaks and strains as it bulges wider and wider, pushing up taller and higher and thicker through the boundaries of space. Her rump smothers and bulges down, diffusing out over both oceans at the same time, as the planet dwindles to a ball, then an egg, then less than that!

"NOOO!" the bronze dragoness roars as the eagle swells rapidly, crashing cutely into her scaly, 20,000-mile body, consuming it as well in feathery warmth. She and the entire planet, every tiny spirit, the moon, and all man-made satellites vanish, snuggled into her loving bulk, as she caw-booms and grrroooooows again.

90,000 miles tingle, tense, tremble, and explode to 110,000...130,000...160,000...gods, on and on she swells, as her influence brings every human and animal alike on the little planet to cuddle into the harmless wall of bulk.

"AAAAAH...H-AAAAAAAAAAAHHHH!!!!!!!"

She gulps and bursts up twice as large, overfed beyond all comprehension by so much love at once flowing into her, filling her up and up. Soon over half a million miles, over 2.5 billion feet, the eagle finally lets out a rolling, thundering sigh, and hugs herself dearly, just to feel her own bulk swell against her embrace.

"MMMMM! I..I FEEL SO GOOD! AMAZINGLY GOOD! HEE!!"

In the minutes taking place during her expansion, as she watches the realm of space both open up and constrict around her, the eagle begins to feel a few odd sensations rolling across her body--external ones, not the tickling pleasure of her growth. As she finally slows her spurts down, she better ses what the reason was:

Planets. Entire planets are on her. She blinks, her beak agape.

"MAGIC!" she caws excitedly. "THEY LOVE ME TOO!"

Down so, so far below, all of Earth is smiling at her outburst. You come off of the shock of her pulsing growth, to find yourself on her beak. You haven't slipped through her atomic structure or pores, so you take a second to chalk it up, perhaps lazily, to magic, before turning to the endless plain of the eagle's yellow beak.

"It's gravity!" you bellow, as best as you can. "You're creating your own gravity well, eagle!"

Her blinks create a concussive blast that rushes through you.

"EEEEE! YOU'RE HERE! MY LITTLE FRIEND!" You can feel the hearts coming off of her.

"I am, yup! You may be a spirit, but you obviously are composed of mass--that mass is so big now that you're pulling cosmic bodies towards you!"

"OOH! HELLO, PLANETS!" she chirps, so big she can snuggle on Jupiter.

"So, are there other spirits, out in the universe?" you ask, starting to wonder.

"OF COURSE THERE ARE," a booming voice replies. An alien-looking figure emerges, swelling up from Jupiter. From the voice, he's clearly male; an insectoid, but thick and bulky, at that! "YOU ARE MASSIVE!! TELL ME...HAVE YOU BEEN SENT BY THE GALAXY SPIRIT, IN SMALLER FORM, TO SEE ONE OF US PLANET SPIRITS?"

"Oh, no, I haven't! I was from Earth, actually!" she says, smiling lovingly. The insect-Jupiter-spirit, easily as big as five Earths, just blushes and clicks his mandibles cutely. "But still, hello! I didn't know we had cousins this far out in space!"

"I-IT'S A PLEASURE," Jupiter spirit chatters, obviously already in love. "I FEEL COMPELLED, FRIEND SPIRIT...T-TO...ER, MAY I...?" he meekly asks, readying his mantis-styled arms in a hug position. She nods rapidly, wiggling her tail feathers all around giddily, in so doing dusting dozens of moons attracted to that region of her.

"MAY I, AS WELL?" a strange, whale-like creature asks. She's much smaller, coming from Venus, and several other planet spirits all cuddle into her as well, like little siblings eager to bask in her radiance. Her golden glow grows brighter as she squeals in joy:

"Y-YES! YES, YOU ALL MAY! HELLO!!!"

Hug upon cuddly hug ensues, affection from entire planet spirits racing into her as she closes her eyes and clicks her beak. A rumble so big it shakes the quadrant echoes out from her as she pants and groans and huffs, the power building at a frightening pace within her golden core!

"GREETINGS, MY LITTLE FRIEND SPIRITS," a colossal, booming voice speaks. Everyone but the trembling, smiling eagle looks out to see the Sun spirit himself, a great, phoenix-like being, incredibly big, and all smiles. He's larger than even the eagle! He takes one look at the great golden eagle, and just absolutely melts. "SUCH A BEAUTY YOU ARE! HOW DID...HOW DID YOU GROW SO LARGE, FELLOW SPIRIT? YOU ARE MORE RADIANT THAN MYSELF!!"

"HEEHEE! FLATTERER!" eagle coos, her vibrations getting massively powerful, the growth wracking her shuddering body as she rumbles away and grins. "OOOHHHHHH! ONE SECOND, SUN SPIRIT...H-HERE WE...G-G-GGGRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW!!!!!!!!!!"

With a concussive blast, the other planets are blown back, the ring of them pushing out as the spirits all whoop and laugh, as though it's just some great ride; as the gravity well pulls them back in, eagle's body beats them to the punch: the monstrous god-bird roars and pulses out a hundred staggering times bigger in size, on the spot! Even the Sun is pulled in slowly, the gawking spirit watching in total awe as her body slams into her kin, all of them cheering and hugging away tenderly, as she grows higher and higher above them, and lower and lower down below.

60,000,000 miles of quivering, happy bird tremble, ripple and blow up yet again by five hundred times! That one spurt sends her rocketing to 300,000,000 miles, over half the distance from the Earth to the Sun--or the Earth, where it used to be. In her gilded feathers, the little blue planet is just fine, unharmed by the huge Sun's blazing adoration of her.

"AMAZING! TRULY AMAZING!" the Sun spirit roars, cuddling her un-burnt body lovingly. "L-LET US BE WITH YOU, SWEET SPIRIT!"

She would answer, but the goddess eagle is still panting and groaning with bliss, her body rippling so much that waves are rocking over her body...she's nowhere near done growing bigger!!!! The pulses get worse and worse, the entire system starting to shake ominously, as she takes in a huge, impossible breath, grooooaaans, and...AND...
13211212121221121.title: The Moon spirit, already influenced, feeds the ...

132112121212211211.content:
Original author: Growasaur

"I-IT'S NNNNOT S-ST-STOPPPPPIIING..."

Eagle's quaking words fall, astonishingly, on deaf ears. The booming avian's many, many occupants are simply too enamored of her, engrossed with cuddling into and generally loving away on her body. Every few seconds a tic races through the rattling ripples quaking through eagle, each tic blowing her up a stretchy bit bigger, as if the growth spurt that's piling up within her is so big, even she has to bulge up bigger before being able to handle it!

The bright, gilded hues dancing over her feathers become brighter still, as she clicks her beak and moans louder. 500,000,000 miles pussssshes hotly up to 600,000,000, and she closes her eyes. 700,000,000 comes and goes as she fluffs out and groans even louder. The rumbling just gets worse and worse and worse, until the cosmos seem to shake angrily around her. All of you deep within her plumage hold tight, smiles of anticipatory glee plastered on every face, human and smaller-god alike.

Her feathery chest surges out hungrily, as the quaking gets so bad it nearly renders eagle a gargantuan, growing blur, bolts of godly energy dancing over her as she spurts up to 900,000,000 miles...and stretches...and streeeetches...and...AND...

"YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY--"

Eagle explodes bigger so violently that the rush is like the end of the world--only snugglier. The inky depths of space melt into a string of colors and ethereal bands of light that snake and warp about her as she triples--no, dectuples--n-no...in one booming heartbeat, eagle has inflated herself up to 50,000,000,000 miles!

"YYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE--"

Another heartbeat, and she's 600,000,000,000 miles tall!!!

"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEESSSS--"

1,200,000,000,000 miles...3,700,000,000,000 miles...the colors shift, then go to black again, and eagle's eyes only open to happy slits as she keeps bellowing her bliss:

"SSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!"< br />
BWHOOMPH! 1.5 light years tall...BWHOOOOOMPH!!6 light years! BA-WHOOOOOOMMMMPH!!! 40 light years!!! Her monstrously vast wings flapflap cutely, wrapping around the Orion nebula entirely as she quickly huffs and shudders and blows up twenty times larger than even it!

"C-CAN'T STOOOOP!!"

She caws and rumbles with growth, the sheer force of the waves pouring off of her vibrating throughout the Cat's Eye Nebula, before she wiggles and billows through it, buffeting the great mass apart with her feathers, dusting it to a million vibrant wisps through her wings. Another gulp and a happy sigh, and eagle balloons furiously up to 1,500 light years, her beak wide open once again as she giggles and pants and swells out ten times as big, in one thick gush of size!

"HAHHHH...AH-AAAAAAH!! L-LOVE ME...MOOOOORE! PLEASE!!!"

She trembles with need, the 12,000 light-year tall bird preening herself, both to feel her own body swelling out, and to nuzzle and thank the nebula spirits that had stuck to her body like tape as she outgrew their homes. Strange rainbow serpents that could swallow a trillion Suns in one bite are darling little flecks compared to eagle, who loves them back and croons and chirps in utter, complete joy.

"BIGGER!"

She tenses up and strains, detonating another 10,000 light years in one rude burst.

"B-BIIIGGGERRR!!!"

Her belly and chest outgrow her for a comical moment, making her thick neck lengthen out and swell in diameter, before she trembles more and explodes even larger, and larger, growth crashing atop frantic growth!

34,000 light years...45,000...75,000!!!

Eagle's adorably huge, gentle eyes glow a brilliant white as they roll back in her skull; the space around her flashes and contorts with the sheer influx of energy that pours into the once-humble little bird. Her talons, each thicker than the nebulae within Orion, could be felt bursting thicker as they curl in pleasure, her beak pushing out further and wider as she click-clicks it in glee. Another rumbling stretch of her feathery hide, and eagle bursts even larger, straining with abandon, as if every moment knowing she might simply burst apart at the seams, and being endlessly thrilled that she won't.

"B-BBB-B-BB-BIIIIIII-IIIIIIIIIGGGGGGGGGGGERRRRRRRRR-HRRRHRRR!!!!!"
She hiccups and rockets up even larger, stronger and fuller with power, leaving her a stunning 100,000 light years in size!! With a cry of joy she feels herself pass a glowing light, before darkness resumes again. She opens her great, massive eyes, blinking, and sighs in bliss as the growth spurt finally, finally ends. Eagle is...holy cow...sh-she's over two billion times larger!!!!

"SO LOVELY!" she giggles, fluffing up in pride and joy. "OH, THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH, LITTLE SPIRIT KIN! I LOVE YOU ALL!!"

"SUCH NOISE," an equally-huge, jarring voice echoes. It is definitely male! A vast, muscled creature resembling a bull emerges from the span of light she had outgrown--the Milky Way, itself!! She was as big as the Milky Way! The bull was just as large, made of shimmering blue light, and he regards eagle calmly for a moment. "GREETINGS, GOLD ONE! I HAD ONLY A MOMENT TO NOTICE YOUR GROWTH, BEFORE YOU EMERGED FROM MY REALM. WHAT A PLEASURE TO MEET ANOTHER AS GREAT AS MYSELF!"

"HEE! HELLO, MILKY WAY SPIRIT! SO PLEASED TO MEET YOU, TOO!" eagle nearly purrs, wiggling her tailfeathers sweetly.

"MIGHT YOU BE TASKED WITH BECOMING A NEW STRETCH OF THE HEAVENS, SUCH AS I ONCE WAS?"

"YOU GREW TOO?" eagle asks, batting her goddess eyes gently.

"I DID, INDEED. I FINALLY STOPPED AT THIS SIZE, AND MY ENERGIES FORMED THE MILKY WAY. I ASSUME YOU ARE NEARLY DONE, AS WELL!"

"OH, I DUNNO! I HOPE NOT, HEE!"

"HMM...THERE IS...AN INTERESTING AURA ABOUT YOU," the spirit muses, cocking his great head and smiling. "I FEEL MOST COMPELLED..."
132112121212211211.title: Eagle grows as big as the Milky Way!!

choices: Picks you up, and flies somewhere
Shudders again, but much worse than before.
132112122.content:
Original author: Infinity421

The eagle caws softly, as if in appreciation and affirmation of your comment. You break off the hug and step out of her feathery embrace, and ask her, "Can you understand me?". The eagle nods, and you step back towards her to continue hugging her, the eagle once again wrapping her wings around you.

The eagle shudders again, and begins to slowly grow taller once more. The wings pressing you into her belly slowly stretch to cover more and more of your body, and her belly rises up further and further away from ground, making it harder to hug.

The eagle stops growing when she is twenty five feet tall, around the same height of an average two storey house. The eagle looks down at you, let's out a soft caw, and...
132112122.title: Caws softly - she can understand you, but canno...

1321121221.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Suddenly, the eagle tosses you onto her back, and when you have a good enough grip, starts flapping her huge wings to gain altitude. You, for the most part, close your eyes, as you have no desire to see how far up you are.

Where does the eagle take you?
1321121221.title: Picks you up, and flies somewhere

1321121222.content:
Original author: Neirv

The eagle starts shaking again, but much worse than before. You step back, worried for her, and ask what's wrong. She doesn't look like she's in much pain, but she's definitely being hurt by whatever's affecting her. Because she hadn't looked hurt when she grew before, you guess it's something else making her feel pain.

Suddenly, you hear the sound of flapping wings from behind you, much louder than they have any right to be. Turning, you see a huge hawk with dark feathers, with a man riding on its back and holding a weird staff aimed at the eagle.

"It's no use," the man said. "Even up close, it's impossible to grow this eagle anymore."

You look confused at the man riding the hawk, and ask, "Okay, who are you, and what's with these giant birds?"

The man looks at you, as if he hadn't seen you yet. "Oh, look, we have a witness. That means I'll have to kill you so you don't tell everyone about this."

You look at the man and the hawk, and behind you at the eagle (who has collapsed on the ground, breathing hard), and reply, "I think nobody would believe me anyway. Now, I'll ask again: who are you?"

The hawk landed, and the man got off its back. He was wearing a kind of torn lab coat, and looked like he might have been a scientist of some sort. He tapped the ground with his staff impatiently.

"Just call me Dr. Size," he said. "I've been trying to perfect the science of size control, and I've just had a breakthrough. Using this staff I designed, I can change the sizes of animals, but apparently, it has its limits."

"And that explains the giant hawk?" you ask.

"Exactly, and the eagle giant--or giantess, rather--behind you. This is something I've been trying to perfect for years, and I've just now learned the trick. I'm planning to field test it on a multitude of animals, and then reveal my findings to the scientific world. Just imagine the uses of giant animals! And the power they could give those who control them!"

"Sounds interesting," you say. "But, how about I just leave now, and you can take this eagle with you. I won't spoil your research to anyone, promise."

Dr. Size looks at you with an evil grin. "Well, the eagle is useless now. She should revert to her original size in a few hours. But maybe you didn't understand the insinuation of my prior monologue.... These giant animals could help me get whatever I want. Even militaries couldn't stop me. And I can't let anyone live who knows about my research."

He jumps back onto his hawk's back, and the giant bird glares at you. "Hawk, kill him," he says.

The hawk lunges at you, its beak open. but just before it reaches you, something else hits it, knocking it aside. You look in surprise, seeing the eagle standing there, glaring at the hawk. She glances over at you, and her face seems to take on a kind expression. She lifts off, and before you know what's happening, she flies towards you, her talons outstretched. She grabs you in them, holding you tightly as you squirm and shout in surprise, and starts flying away.
1321121222.title: Shudders again, but much worse than before.

choices: The eagle's head- she's as tall as you!
The eagle's belly- she's twelve feet tall!
1321122.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You slowly hike along the mountain path, taking your time to enjoy the scenery. You sit down to rest for a second, and as you do, you hear a loud cry from higher up on the mountain, and a large black shape starts to descend towards you. You are rather calm, as you knew it was an eagle that the cry belonged to, and you has seen her from afar several times, using binoculars. You close your eyes for several seconds, and hear a loud thump from behind you as she lands.

That was odd. Eagles weren't that, heavy, there was no way she could make such a loud noise simply by landing. You stand up and turn around, only to be face to face with...
1321122.title: Already giant.

choices: Lands right in front of you, blocking your escape--and...talks?!
Grows even larger in the air, and catches you (gently!) in her talons!
13211222.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

You blink, dumbfounded. Then blink again. At first, you don't know what the heck you're looking at--you expected to find the familiar eagle, but instead you find yourself looking at...a white wall, inches from your face.

Seeing something pop inches in front of you, out in the wilderness should have scared you senseless and sent you running, but the sheer strangeness of this kept you rooted to your spot, staring forward with wide eyes and a cocked eyebrow (which was a rather silly expression--good thing you were alone out there, or people would be laughing at you.) Curiosity overcomes self-preservation, and you raise a hand to touch the strange barrier...

It's made of...feathers? Very large feathers, bigger than any bird has business having. And, somehow, familiar...

A loud, avain Caw! resounds in your ears, and your instincts belatedly kick in as you scramble backwards, only to trip on a rock and fall heavily on your rear. You let out an "Oof!" of pain and look upwards, remembering the sudden bird-cry--

And find the ever-familiar female eagle standing over you, wings spread, head cocked to one side curiously...and twelve feet tall, covering you in her shadow. Her head was as big as your whole chest, maybe bigger. Her wingspan was easily wider than you were tall! And she was looking right at you.

Now, you had always liked this particular eagle; how she always seemed to turn up whenever you went hiking, but you also knew that eagles were called "birds of prey" for a reason. At at that size (how DID she get so darn BIG, anyway?!) she could easily chomp you like a mouse! And so, with a high yelp, you scramble to your feet and run like heck away from the over-sized bird.

After a few steps you realize that may just encourage you to come after her, but that revelation doesn't make you slow down. Neither do the loud wingbeats behind you, and the outsized avian shadow on the ground.

Making sure there wasn't anything you could trip over on the path, you risk a look back and find the giant eagle soaring through the air, following you!
"Oh,come on!! I just want to go on a hike without getting eaten! Is that so much to ask for?!" You call out in half-terrified frustration.

The eagle angles downward and dives toward you like a feathered Stuka. Even as you keep running full-tilt away from her, you can't help but watch as she gets ever closer, until she...
13211222.title: The eagle's belly- she's twelve feet tall!

choices: "You scared me... You're huge, and I thought you would eat me!"
"Um, before that...how did you get so big. and how are you talking?"
132112221.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

Carrying a gust of air behind her, the eagle dives in front of you, missing a chance to snatch you up in her talons as you duck just in time to make her overshoot! You allow yourself a mental pat on the back--

Which you regret, because now the twelve-foot avian lands directly in your path, spreading her wings out across the path: your escape was blocked, to go around her meant going off the path onto rocky, uneven ground--where you'd be easy pickings. Grim as that news is, it doesn't reach from your brain to your legs fast enough to turn around, and you keep running forward, right into the eagle's belly!

Whump! Thud.

You collide face-first into the soft, feathery wall, then fall flat on your back and knock the wind out of yourself.
Dang, that didn't go as planned.

Towering above you, the eagle cocks her head to one side, then the other, her yellow eyes alive with that intent and focus all birds of prey have--though even now, impossibly huge and likely about to make lunch out of you, she manages to make it look cute. Well, at least she--

"Are you alright?! Why did you run from me, you've seen me before." She chirps in a bright, feminine voice.

...What.

With a...quite adorable squawk, she sits down next to you and holds out a wing to give shade as you sit up. Once again, you can't help but stare up at her in disbelief and confusion.

"You looked so silly earlier, your eyes were huge! But then you poked me, looked all scared, and ran away. Why?" Defying all laws of reason and science, she continues speaking to you...speaking to you! That alone should have sent you running...

But the way she cocked her head when she asked that question was just too blasted cute! With a mental shrug, you inch closer to her body, getting further into the shade provided by her wing. Seeing this, your avian comrade gives a happy trill and--you can't believe it--reaches her head down and nuzzles you.

"Ah, that's better!" she coos, giggling a bit. "Now, what's up? I've never seen you just up and run like that before on my flights, not from me anyway."

Well, no point in a one-sided conversation. You decide to respond, and answer....
132112221.title: Talking Turkey....Except With An Eagle
