Original author: Kardo

A Roc, huh? Those birds are pretty huge... Alright, who are you?
133.title: Roc

1332.content:
Alright then. Here goes the story.

You’re on a ship transporting an elephant. Why, you don’t know. You just got assigned to holding onto a rope that is holding the elephant down. Suddenly, everyone yells and points into the distance. You think this is unimportant and sit next to the elephant. You being a smart chicken nugget, decided to wrap the rope around your hand several time. There’s no getting that off anytime soon. Everyone is still yelling and wonder why. It’s almost night, what could be seen? Surely not land. Then a shadow passes over. The captain calls all but you to arms. Before anyone can do anything, however, the elephant is suddenly snatched into the air. The rope yanking you into the air as well. You can’t tell what grabbed it, but you decide to find out later. The elephant is trumpeting in pain and your ears going along for the ride. Soon, you come to a nest made of barren, uprooted trees. That’s when you realize what got you. The roc from that book you got at the store. You didn’t believe the story, but now you wish you’d paid more attention. All you remember is that the roc is female. The elephant is dropped into the nest and you can barely make out multiple others, maybe five in total. There are other animals in the heat as well. Goats, pigs, cattle, all clustered in the large nest. What catches your eye, however, are the net fulls of people. It seems the roc is a clever girl, catching humans in hunting traps and fishing nets. You land on the elephant’s back. You notice that none of the animals have claw marks on them, they are all intact. The giant bird lands in the nest, without crushing anything. When she’s lands, she obliviously slices the rope that is tied to your hand. However, it was cut closer to the elephant, you now you have a rope snake on your arm. You jump down and land on the bird’s right foot. She doesn’t notice however, and continues to look at her collection of animals. You make it to under her stomach when she she sits down, amazingly not crushing anything. Now you’re leaning against her stomach and you’re struggling to get back up. The bird starts swallowing the animals whole. As they travel, you can see the bulges they make Andy hear and feel them in her stomach. She’s gone through at least 3/4 of the previous total and now looks satisfied. The only things left are two elephants and the bags of people. The mixture of animals in her stomach are making a horrific ruckus and it’s making you scared. Suddenly, some of them pound and it hits you in the face, startling you. The roc lowers her head to her belly and strokes it with her beak. You dive out of the way and are miraculously not spotted. However, you land on a sharp branch and you cry out. When you look over, the roc is clearly looking at you.
1332.title: A human meeting a Roc

13321.content: You soon come to and wake up to find the roc towering over you. She lowers her head and her forked tongue snakes out of her fanged beak. She walks closer to you while dragging her tongue across your face. She seems to enjoy your taste as she licks her beak. You attempt to run, but she snatches you up in her beak. She doesn't bite you, but her grip is strong enough that you can’t move. She then settles down and tucks you under her wing, then tucks her head under the other wing and goes to sleep.
13321.title: Oof.

choices: In the roc's crop or stomach.
In the roc's beak or on the ground.
133211.content: You struggle in her beak. Even when she is not trying to hold you, her shear size does the job well enough. It would be impossible for you to try and leave the roc's beak as it is too heavy for you to lift and too much of your body is already inside. While it does not make you happy, the next best thing would be to crawl fully inside of the beak, that way she at least doesn't crush you to death. She might eat you, but she could have done that anyways. It is one less thing for you to be worried about. The roc's tongue undulates underneath you as you struggle to pull your legs inside of the roc's beak. You manage to pull your legs inside before you get stuck. You pull harder and feel your shoes fall off and your feet slip inside. Sitting on the roc's tongue, you pull off your socks as nothing's worse than wet socks and put them in your pocket. You try to stand up but the roc's tongue is moving to much so you slip and fall down. Sighing, you lay there on the roc's tongue, hoping against hope that you will make it out alive. With nothing else to do in the dark cave that is the roc's beak, you slowly drift asleep. When you wake up you are...
133211.title: Continue.

1332112.content: You wake up on one of the roc's feet. She removes her head from under her wing. She stretches her neck and yawns, revealing her slimy tongue. She shifts her feet, which causes you to hold on. She notices this and lowers her head to you. You open your eyes to be met with the roc's eyes.
1332112.title: In the roc's beak or on the ground.

choices: Offer to rub her wings and body.
13321122.content: You sit in stunned silence as the roc looks you over. She prods you with her beak a bit as she does so. She ends her investigation with a loud chirp and gives you a full body lick. She seems to like you, at least enough for her not to want to eat you at the moment. The roc rubs her beak against you for a moment before she starts to preen her feathers. You watch her preen as you wonder what to do next,

You are walking throughout the countryside and are beginning to realise just how late it is. You gaze up at the sky and see several stars, but quickly look back down when you hear a squelching noise. You see a round shape rapidly crawling towards you. You shine your flashlight in it's direction and it is revealed to be a large, gelatinous mass composed of green slime.
How big is it?

Original author: Kardo

The small slime creature stops as the flashlight shines at it. It seems startled by the sudden light, and sits there, jiggling faintly. A little frightened, as you remember your old B movies, you still take a step forward.

The slime doesn't move, but...
14121.title: The size of a bean bag

choices: Go home, and examine it there.
Shine your flashlight at it again, see if it grows more.
141212.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You watch the slime shudder slightly, and stop moving. Perhaps it was scared? Or maybe your light was hruting, or even harming it? These thoughts are dispelled when you see the slime bulge slightly, emitting a sort of bubbling noise, then bulge outwards again and begin to expand. The blob monster continues to slowly grow as scenes from various movies flash through your head. Hopefully it will be friendly, you think. The blob monster stops growing when it reaches waist height, and you think of what to do next.
141212.title: It shudders...

choices: Go to sleep, you can test it in the morning.
1412121.content:
Original author: Infinity421

Quickly thinkg of what to do, you indicate to the now waist high slime to follow you, and begin walking to your house, making sure it is following you. After several minutes of walking you reach your house, and you unlock the door to allow you both to enter. You hesitantly turn on the lights, and watch the slime closely for a few seconds afterwards. Just as before, it emits a bubbling noise, though it is much softer and quieter now, and grows several inches taller before its growth stops completely. This puzzles you somewhat. You had confirmed that artificial light made it grow, but why did the lightbulbs in your house have such little an effect on it? Perhaps it was something about your flashlight that made it grow so much. You yawn heavily, and decide what to do next...
1412121.title: Go home, and examine it there.

choices: No, only artificial light makes it grow.
14121212.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You realise just how tired you are and decide to go to sleep. The slime appears to notice this and stretches out two portions of itself to act as arms, and attempts to pull you down on itself so you can use it as a bed. You oblige its request and sit down on it, then lay back. It is easily large for you to lie down on, and it decreases in height slightly then stretches outwards to allow you a bit more room to move. You sink into the slime slightly as you make yourself comfortable and drift off to sleep.

You groggily wake up, and feel the slime underneath you. You open your eyes and look at the green mass, and see a small group of bubbles from inside the slime forming and floating up to the top of it, where they burst, every so often. You assume it is sleeping, and continue recline on it for several minutes. However, a glint catches your eye, and you see several slivers of light filtering in through the window, and touching the slime.
Does the slime grow?
14121212.title: Go to sleep, you can test it in the morning.

141212121.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You watch the slime shudder in its sleep, then begin to expand. It feels extremely odd being gradually lifted up into the air as it grows, though not in a bad way. 14121212112212.content:
Original author: 1138abc

You felt a chill run down your spine as you saw how quickly the creature managed to dwarf you in size. The sheer size of it was both incredible and worrying. You thought to yourself the possibilities if it managed to escape your home, but your daydreams were quickly broken as you heard the giant monster make its way to the one place you'd least expect it to go.

Your room.

Slowly but surly, the things within your room started to become absorbed into the mammoth slime creature. First it was your chair, then your desk, even your bed! It gurgled, it groaned, and it shuddered. You watched in fear this time as in mere seconds, the contents of your room were gone. You watched as the mammoth green entity grew out even more, forcing cracks into the nearby walls, as more of itself continued to come into existence.

It wasn't long until the creature began to search for more things to fuel its growth, yet something caught your eye. As the slime grew before you, it seemed to be searching more ferociously. It seemed to move quicker, and absorb with more haste than before. It's actions seemed more calculated than before. You began to ponder before it dawned to you. As the slime grows, it becomes more intelligent and thus, desires to grow even MORE. It's an endless cycle really, one that scared the living shit out of you due to the thought of it escaping and having a limitless growth supply from the sun and even the uni--

Your thought again were disturbed as the groaning grew louder. The gurgling and shuddering increased in intensity, and you now looked before a monstrous blob. It had grown so much, that it occupied not only the living room, but the hallway, bathroom, your room, even the kitchen! Even worse, you saw it try to shift its way upstairs, its gargantuan size nearly suffocating you as it moved.

You had to think of something quickly, and you somehow mustered the courage to confront this growing alien. you yelled at the top of your lunges, "STOP!"

Almost immediately, it had stopped its advance upstairs, and shifted itself to give you room to breath. A faint bubbling noise began to be heard, and a low groan was emanated. It actually looked.....guilty. As if it was a child giving in to a frenzy, oblivious to the outside world. You smiled faintly at its innocence, and tried to speak a little more calmly, "Look, I know you probably like...doing that growing thing or whatever..." The bubbling began to increase significantly, and it shifted its weight sporadically, as if showing a significant sign of glee. It obviously took great pleasure in growing. "But you have to take things slow for a bit, ok buddy? I don't want you growing out of my house in just one day."

The low groaning took over the bubbling this time, as if expressing a hint of sadness, but no aggression whatsoever. Looking on it with pity, you tried to comfort it while laughing a bit, "Hey, come on, don't be like that, you'll have plenty of room to grow once we find you a new place. But you're going to need a name....how bout, Bessy?" A huge gurgling noise of disgust took hold, it clearly didn't take too kindly to a feminine name. "Ok...how bout.....Rex?" Bubbling again, you figured correctly that it or "he" enjoyed the new designation.

Looking around, you sincerely took into account just how huge "Rex" was now. And you knew just the place to help him grow without worrying about escaping into the city.

The sewers.

They were massive, and stretched across every inch of the city. There was plenty of things for him to absorb down there, and he could grow for quite a while before.....well....you didn't want to think about him becoming city sized just yet, though it did catch your interest.

However, you had a choice to make.
14121212112212.title: Your bedroom

choices: Let Rex absorb some things along the way.
Get to the sewers as quickly as possible.
141212121122122.content:
Original author: 1138abc

You stared in awe at the slime behemoth before you. Scared as you were, you couldn't shake that faint feeling of enjoyment, it actually felt good watching this creature quickly outgrow you and dwarf you in sheer mass and size. Your heart skipped a few beats as you started to imagine the true possibilities of its growth, if it's desire to grow was sparked with this ferocity just by absorbing a few seconds of sunlight, imagine how monstrously huge it would get if it stayed in the light for w few minutes? A few hours? Dare you say it, allow it to absorb everyth---

There you went again, trailing off inside your head, only to be interrupted by the pleasant groaning of your gigantic friend. Even though "his" growth had subsided, for now, it was quite clear that he was enjoying every second of his new-found size. The groans got slightly deeper and deeper as Rex shifted its body around the first floor of your house. You had almost forgotten the fact that he now occupied your ENTIRE first floor. Like before, the creature started to extend itself to hug you, and you were almost crushed against the wall by Rex, feeling the massive alien attempt to display its affection towards you. However, the pressure grew lighter, and you regained your breath again.

You tried to lean your way past your giant friend, and as far as you could see there was green. Just green. His green gelatinous yet somewhat solid mass had filled your first floor, and his groaning proved he was well aware of that as well. You gave in to the increasing groans, "Hey. buddy. You feel like growing just a bit more? I got some more stuff upstairs." You almost lost your balance as the groaning nearly shook the house following your statement. Squeezing past Rex's body, you started up the stairs, followed by a thin tentacle jutting off of Rex.

The second floor of your house was roughly the same size as your first. It had another bedroom, bathroom, a storage area, exercise room, and an office for your computer. You opened the door to the bedroom, and breathed heavily before allowing the thin, extending tentacle to move its way in. "Now buddy, remember, I want you to stay IN the house, ok?" And just like that, the tentacle shot itself forward with ungodly speed, and latched itself to a nearby lamp. You watched in amazement as it was quickly consumed by the thin tentacle, which started to shift and widen. It groaned as it expanded and thickened. The tentacle, which was no thinner than your Ipod's earbuds, was now as thick as your arm.

It shifted, absorbing your cups and clocks on the nightstand, and then the nightstand itself. Groaning as more itself came into existence, the tentacle was twice the width of your thigh, but the groaning suddenly grew louder. You didn't understand your situation until you were nearly knocked on your face when more of Rex poured into the room from downstairs, impatient to grow bigger. You quickly darted out of the room as its contents were completely absorbed, and more of Rex simply expanded into the hallway, dwarfing you even more with his size and power. Rex seemed to be in pure bliss, his desire to grow was insatiable. You watched with a hidden smirk as he poured and shifted himself to the other rooms, each one expanding him even more than the last. groaning more and more, GROWING more and more, until you were finally pushed against the wall.

It was official, Rex had literally eaten you out of house and home. and the groaning was returned to its previous, low, rising state. You couldn't help but smile at the fact that in less than a day, Rex had not only been no bigger than your sock, but had also outgrown both you, your room, and now, your entire house! The house creaked as Rex's enormous body shifted and repositioned itself. You barely managed to squeeze yourself back downstairs, when something caught your eye. The window no longer shined with beams of light. Duh! It was nighttime! All this growing must have caused you to lose track of time.

You knew Rex wouldn't be able to last long in your cramped house now. And nighttime was perhaps the only way of moving him carefully. You quickly remembered your plan. Move him into the sewers, and set up your own little "home" there. He could grow quite a...."bit", you thought. But, given the fact he was able to absorb everything in your home (and would probably absorbed it too if you hadn't stopped him), the sewer would only be a temporary residence at best. In fact, you knew it would only be a matter of time until Rex outgrew even the pla---

You shook your head and went back to the task at hand. "Hey! Come on buddy, it's time I show you a new place we can stay." You opened the door after struggling past Rex, and urged him to follow you. The house creaked and moaned as Rex slowly emptied himself from the structure. You watched as he slowly exited the building. At first, you could only see a door sized amount of him, then a car sized. Then a pool sized, until finally the house-sized blob was in full view, and you were....scared to see just how big he really was now. You gulped, but smiled. You knew just how much Rex adores you. Afterall, YOU were the person who helped him get this big in the first place.

The sewers were vast and magnificent. You used to play down there when you were a child, crossing the city underground using the labyrinth-like maze to get from one end of the city to the other. In fact, you had an old fort you built using your old treehouse deep within the sewer itself. You could let Rex grow as much as he wanted, and you could finally get some sleep. You didn't know how long it would take him to outgrow your new "home", but it would be a start. Although you didn't take into account just how insatiable Rex really was.....
141212121122122.title: Let Rex grow into the second floor, a little mo...

You weren't sure how long you had until dawn, but you couldn't have Rex outgrowing the planet so quickly. You begin to walk briskly to where the entrance of the sewers was located, the house sized mass of green slime following behind you. Rex gurgled and groaned every so often, clearly wanting to absorb everything in sight, but keeping its growth-lust in check.

After about half an hour of walking, you come to the entrance to the sewers. It was a huge tunnel of corrugated metal embedded into the side of a hill, far away from the nearest houses; just inside a minor forest, with several corridors leading into the maintenance tunnels. Turning back to Rex, you watch the slime fidget slightly, and decide to humour him.

"Alright, Rex, I guess you can have a couple of the trees, Just don't go overboard again." Original author: 1138abc

As Rex continued to expand and tower above you, you started to feel a little scared again. Less than 24 hours ago, this...thing was only roughly the size of a bean bag. And now? It was bigger than your house! And you knew, deep down, that Rex would only want to keep getting bigger and bigger, and you didn't know how long it would be until he would just give in to his growth lust and start absorbing everything in sight. Though you had to admit, it was rather thrilling watching him slowly dwarf you. The sheer mass of Rex was outstanding!

The loud gurgling and groaning finally tuned down, and by the grace of God, Rex seemed content with the few trees. Gesturing nervously to the entrance, you watched as the mammoth slime slowly approached you, filling your entire vision. At first you thought it was coming for you next, that he had somehow discarded you as a friend, that he was a...monster. But...no....as the titanic slime approached it just simply began forcing its ungodly frame into the entrance. and you followed in suit.

The sewers were vast and long. They ran the entire length of the city. And best of all, they had plenty of materials to keep Rex....busy. You thought it would take a while for Rex to be able to, literally, "fill up" the sewers, but, given how quickly he outgrew your home, you were starting to have doubts.

Your voice was shaky this time, nervous as you spoke, "W-w-w-ell R-r-ex.....we h-h-h-ere. Just make yours-s-s-self at home. Just....just don't go overbo--"

You were interrupted as Rex hungrily and fiercely began absorbing the water around him, already swelling at an alarming rate. This was impossible, he had already reached the sewer's ceiling in an instant, nearly doubling in size! His monstrous form gurgled and groaned much MUCH deeper and louder now, as he the actual SOUND of him expanding filled your ears. He grew...and grew....and grew....and you didn't know what to expect this time...

Again, Rex uses two thick slime tentacles to hug you to its bulk, but for some reason, despite hugging you tighter and tighter every second, you feel no discomfort from it at all, even though the pressure being exerted should have powderized your bones.

Rex begins to bubble again, obviously pleased beyond measure with his latest spurt. Judging by how long he'd been growing for, and at such a rate, he had to be under a fair portion of the city at this point, which would make him several hundred feet tall, if he hadn't already ballooned into the thousands.

STREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEETCH........

Rex effortlessly blasts up in size, quickly grinding through the ceiling as walls as he explodes larger, allowing you just enough room inside him to move into a sitting position. Rex, despite his best efforts, automatically absorbs everything he touches, the slime growing not just higher, wider and longer, but now deeper as well, as a fifty foot tentacle steamrolls into the town where you lived, bulldozing and absorbing it within milliseconds, but leaving the people unharmed.

You swallow and draw your knees into your chest as you try not to think of how big Rex is getting, and how much bigger he is going to get as a result. A thin tentacle, slightly thicker than your arm, snakes around you in a slimy hug even as it pulses larger along with Rex's entire body, the slime being almost a mile tall now...

And then, Rex's unstoppable growth smashes a section of him into a distant city, harmlessly absorbing skyscrapers, apartment blocks, vehicles, leaving the people inside them completely safe and sound.

A wave of calm suddenly envelops you,coaxing your fears away gradually, even as you hear and feel Rex groaning with another rush of size, then another. Rex was still growing, uncontrollably colliding with and smothering over the entire city, then out over the inroads and interstates surrounding, tentacles gently lashing about, feeling the forests and mountains over curiously as it bulges larger. There isn't even a hint of malice to Rex, you can feel only an unending affection flowing over you; the same seems to be the case for everyone Rex has absorbed, the unharmed millions calmly remaining in place. Maybe this isn't so bad, after all--maybe this is how it ought to be: no more strife, poverty, inequality, war--pretty much anything bad, you name it.

Now, there was just a feeling of escalating joy, of togetherness, as Rex tingled and grew even bigger, rolling over every particle of mass the terrain of earth has to offer. In minutes, Rex is as wide as the entire countryside, ballooning higher and higher; tentacles whip all over happily, touching the clouds experimentally as the slime rises up to ten miles in height, then twenty, pumping up bigger, faster, taking in over three dozen cities!

Rex booms even larger, on the spot, growing with gentle yet wild abandon over the local mountain range, absorbing mile after mile of rock, spilling over into the neighboring states from all sides, with no effort. Rex just won't stop growing! You can't keep from loving the growing slime, Rex's tentacles stroking you over thankfully as he gets bigger and bigger, now as wide as four states...then ten...then twenty!!

Just then, you see a torrent of missiles headed across the skies, seemingly from every ocean, all headed towards Rex--looks like the other countries aren't quite as enthused about the situation as you are...

142313.content:
Marina the Mosquito had just smelled blood. It was delicious. She was were it was. In a human. Surely they can spare just a little bit of it, they have so much of it and she was so small.

She made a bee line for the human, this one was smaller then usual.

DOOOING!!!

She hit something, it gave a little and then bounced back. She was no stuck she tried to get out but that just made her more stuck.

She could do nothing but wait, surely for her end.

The web, which she release was what she was stuck on stacked to vibrate. Whatever was coming was getting nearer and nearer. That was it, the end.

She could feel something looming over her. She was terrified. Just when she was sure then next thing she would feel would be her exoskeleton being cracked open and her insides digested the beast spoke, "I'm stopping you because your about to do something as awful as it accidental. If you understand this tell me and I'll unstick you, explain what's happening and make it so the bad thing can't happen. I Know your terrified and are probably not ready or even capable of talking right now so I just leave you there for a couple of days, talk to me when you can and I get you out."

The mosquito was far to scared to talk so the spider just walked off. After a bit the mosquito was calm enough to talk. It was sure there was some sort of trick. After a bit more thinking she realised a the spider tricking her would be pointless, she was already completely under it control. She decided so give it shot, if she didn't she was doomed anyway.

"Hmm spider, I'll like to be let out," asked the mosquito timidly.

The spider came over and unwrapped the mosquito and ate all the sticky silk around it. Then the spider grew from 1 inches across to 1 and half.

"Ah, you seem to have broke a wing, I but that a split first," said the spider as it did so it then grew again to 2 inches across.

"Wait, why are you growing," asked the mosquito.

"Well I don't know they deeper 'why' of it but I know the cause. 9 days ago now a meteor exploded in earth atmosphere. It was a alien supercomputer or something, people way smarter then me are still trying to find out. When that happened a smaller fraction of all animal, regardless of species were suddenly uplifted to sapience. Fortunately we can all talk to each other and to the humans too. Another effect of it is that when one of those uplifted animals does a good need they grow bigger. I was only a half of Millimetre across when I was uplifted. I've been doing since then what I didn't know I was doing before. Stopping you Mosquitos from giving humans a horrible disease," explained the spider.

"I wasn't planning on doing anything like that, I just wanted a little bit of blood for my babies," protested Marina

"I'm sure of that, but malaria don't care about you intentions. If you have it, which you probably do, it you bite that human there get it to, they get sick and they might die," further explained the spider.

"But, I've bit humans before, even a couple after I was uplifted, could I have made them sick?" asked Marina desperately.

"There's a chance, but even it you did they probably won't die, it still be awful but they'll probably live," reassured the spider.

"But I might have killed someone?" checked Marina

"Yes, I completely unfair but yes," confirmed the spider. "But what's important is what you do now. Fortunately you don't need blood to live just to lay ridiculous amounts of eggs. So abstain for that for now. But there is a more permanent solution, be can cure you and at the same time help wipe out the disease completely."

"So what do I do"

"It all rather complicated, but first I have to take you to a human. Do climb on my back I'll get you past my non sapient brothers, sisters and cousins so me can call that human"

The mosquito climbs on the spiders back and they move off.
142313.title: A mosquito avoids a big mistake

142321.content:
Its was the 5th annual meeting of the sapience searching society. The whole point of the society was to find non human sapience, meet it and make friends with it. The society was willing to explore any options to find or make this sapience, interstellar travel, dimensional portals, time travel, robotics or massive genetic engineering. As of yet now of their ideas had Bourne fruit.

The things brought up by the speakers so far were either purely theoretical, very very unlikely or would take decades of technological advancement at best. The next speaker started to talk about octopuses and about how they were possibly the closest non human animal on earth to sapience. They had tool use, they had something close to language, they could learn. The only thing holding them back was there very short life spans of just 2 or 3 years. The speaker had found a few relatively small genetic changes that would, hopefully, increase their life spans to near humans levels.

It was soon agreed to fund this project. They would start with just a single octopus, the genetic change would be made in the egg and it would be raised with humans from then on.

They would soon discovered that the octopus would just keep growing with no upper limit on size. As it increased in size it would also grow smarter and friendlier.

The eagle's grown continues to power her up, smashing through the one thousand foot mark, then forcing her body to double in size and making another five hundred feet leap on, and finally stopping her growth at two thousand five hundred feet tall.

15222211122221221121211.content:
Original author: Growasaur

A ripple runs through each of the gargantuan animals, which in turn swells into a deep, portentous quake that shakes the ground a little, then more, until you find yourself teetering awkwardly to stay standing--you catch yourself mid-fall, resting arms-wide-open on the prodigious toe of the raptor; even as the rumbling increases, she smiles down at you from way, high up, giving you a gentle nudge back via the toe. Then, it happens: the orca begins to balloon out bigger and longer and heavier, its smoothly-slick sides pumping out into the eagle and raptor, the tail flowing underneath the enormous giraffe's legs; it fills that space, until the growing giraffe finds its front digits sliding up off the firmament, even as she grows along with the others! The eagle caws gleefully, closing its eyes as it rockets larger, taking to levels of air that no other avian could ever manage, at over 3,000 feet tall, then 4,000, then 5,000; the raptor presses herself into the orca's inflating bulk, rubbing into it with a loud huff through the nostrils.

You still ride the raptor's growing toe, clinging tight, as the single digit alone lifts you so high up you can see the neighborhood below with ease! At 1 mile in size, the eagle bulges out in girth, flapping her wings approvingly, before she lurches inward and surges up to quadruple that stature, soaring with a joyful screech to over 8 miles in height! The lower clouds play around her ponderous feathers, each tingling not in the breeze, but from the tingling of her growth-soaked body; the giraffe swells up from behind the orca, her neck so long that she can look over the mass of growing fauna, before she, the orca, and the eagle all glance over at the raptor: she shudders worse than all of them, and it's getting more and more intense, even though her 10-mile size matches theirs, all of them towering well above the clouds! But why?

Your clinging to the raptor, you soon realize, constitutes a hug, and a huge, prolonged one, at that! You've just compounded her growth by stacking a much larger wave atop the current one! The other animals gawk as the raptor smiles at them, and prepares to explode...
15222211122221221121211.title: The animals grow much, much larger.

choices: The raptor grows even larger--much, much larger! She can't stop anymore!!
The other animals are overfed by her affection!! Lookout, world!!
152222111222212211212111.content:
Original author: Growasaur

The raptor's inward rumbling builds and builds, the ground far below shaking more and more forcefully; down at her lower haunches and thick tail, the entire city and surrounding valley tremble, both with anticipation and physically, before she closes her enormous eyes, opens her maw wide, and bellows with a gratified roar, long and loud: she utterly booms up in size, a single spurt forcing her stretching skin out and out, her arms flowing into the sky, her toes towering taller over entire skyscrapers, her shadows spilling first over the landscape and unharmed spectators, then, astonishingly, even over the other animals! Even at 10 miles in height, all of them are pushed back by the contours of her shuddering growth; the female reptile lets her tongue flop out cutely, bursting up to 15 miles, then 17, then 22, then 30, triple the size of the others!

The thing of it is, the bigger she grows, the more you and the other animals find themselves reflexively clutching her inflating sides--meaning all of them and you are hugging her even tighter, more and more growth flooding into her 50-mile tall frame! On and on she balloons, curling her talons as they scrape over an entire local mountain range, dragging up through the forested slopes, clouds parting submissively around her expanding belly; she groans all over, rubbing quite gratefully at her comrades as they inadvertently pump her with more size yet, her 70-mile body blowing up to 90 miles, then 110!

Even from afar, in planes or on the ground, she can be seen, dominating the entire portion of the state just by sitting there, the other gigantic animals seeming to shrink against her 140-mile tall body; you can't let go of her toe, hence the conundrum--until she brings her still-swelling tail over to you, flicking it helpfully, offering to let you slip unharmed onto it; she's so amazingly big, yet she gathers the other animals in her arms like little toys, and squeezes them gladly, hugging all of them at once, and in so doing, making them all hug her even more!

200 miles...300 miles...400 miles...500 miles...600 miles...she's beginning to appear on radars worldwide, with some ease, as she swallows more and more of the country, her growth actually escalating, instead of slowing!! And yet, all the other animals tingle with a new wave of power, the more she hugs them...
152222111222212211212111.title: The raptor goes giga, and then some!

choices: The rumbling is worse than ever--she's about to go cosmic!!
The eagle suddenly starts being flooded with her power!!
1522221112222122112121111.content:
Original author: Growasaur

...though as much as they surge and swell in her growing arms, she continually outmatches them, as she still keeps their hugs comparatively lower, set against how many she is receiving--the swath of nearby cities rub and hug automatically against her expanding wall of a rump and tail, adding to the flame, as she roars louder and deeper, only to hiccup cutely, then erupt to over 900 miles in size, even sitting down on the shrinking country beneath her; the other animals are titans themselves, yet remain mere toys in her increasingly over-sized grip. You can only see a vast tower of scales rising higher and higher, tricks of aerial perspective bleaching out her upper body, seemingly swallowed by the bright blue skies, the very clouds themselves seeming to bow to her from far, far below.

1,000 miles tall! She quakes and quivers and twitches all over, the rapt raptor relishing every tingly burst within her 1,200 mile tall form; realizing you've effectively created godlings, and seeing no way, nor any honest wish to see any of them cease their magnificent growth...well, you just shrug, really, and dig in deep, hugging the immense plane of a single scale, feeling it stretch out further and further under you, her thankful love and affection pouring off like some warm feminine radiation; 1,400 miles...1,700 miles...she pumps up well into the atmosphere and beyond, the cool glowing blues of the planet's curvature playing out wide for her to see, only to pull back and dwindle in respect, as the raptor snorts happily, clicking her monstrous talons on the hemisphere's sides, her tail slapping cutely against the South Pole, as she just gets larger and larger, without stop or slow, no hindrance or reservation shown.

The orca feels itself grow and grow, just staying big enough to keep visible on her rumbling bulk, her pulling hide tugging him up and away from the eagle and giraffe, who look at each other, then way, way up, big enough still to see her smiling jaws pushing up into space; the eagle, now over 300 miles tall, flaps up to her muzzle, and she licks her over with growth-addled gusto, quite pleased to see her friend up there with her. She nuzzles her belly, making the eagle cry out as she balloons at the affection, rippling and bulging out to 600 miles, against her whopping 9,000! Covering more and more of the entire planet, she cocks her head, and shifts herself a bit, hugging the entire thing happily, sharing her wanton dino-bliss with all below, hoping they're all as happy as she is, as she shudders again, and again...
1522221112222122112121111.title: The raptor grows even larger--much, much larger...

15222211122221221121211111.content:
Original author: Growasaur

Oh, eggs--now you've really done it.

The female raptor rests a jaw longer than all of California along the planet's curve; she gusts out a colossal jet of air, stirring the entire atmosphere, as her belly begins to rumble into the pacific ocean, sending out wave after wave over the remainder of the hemisphere, her toes clenching greedily into the south pole; she chuffs in reptilian pleasure, before growing again, pumping up warmly to over 10,000 miles in size, then 11,000...12,000...13,000...you all hold on tight, even though you know it's what's causing everything to go overboard, feeling her body ripple and rage larger all over the dwindling globe; feeds come in of her toes digging in around new zealand, as seattle sees her nose pushing over entire mountains and countries, clouds parting around her lower chin as it ripples bigger and bigger...

She lick-licks the planet lovingly, sharing her growy bliss with the world, as her size escalates to over 20,000 miles, the growth of the other animals only serving to further fuel hers! The planet shrinks until it matches her staggering size, the stupendously big, evergrowing dinosaur roaring into space impossibly, before the entire planet's population gives in and hugs her tightly, making her tremble and DOUBLE in size, snugging the beachball-sized planet to herself triumphantly. She snorts and nips the moon in her jaws, playing with it, her tongue getting stuck to the colder surface--she blinks at this, then closes her jaws and simply sucks on it until it wears away like candy. She gulps the last bit down and purrs, nosing curiously over on Mars as she grows faster; it barely registers against her body's exploding size, but she likes snuffling on it anyway, blowing it away unharmed as she does so. The entire time she grows and grows, as you cling tight along with the planet, caught in her gravity, supplied her unexplained breathable atmosphere, wondering just how big and beautiful she'll continue growing at this rate.

Now over 50,000,000 miles in size, and still shaking with growth, she floats freely in space and regards the Sun with eager eyes, before something very, very small comes her way; squinting, you notice an entire armada of strange ships--good grief, you've grown out so far that aliens have found her!! Some strange language echoes in your heads, amplified by their machinery, which adjusts to English:

"Strange planet-creature! Stop your growing at once! We are new to this system, and cannot study it with your constant growth interfering!"

The armada is really quite huge, but versus the raptor, they are hardly even gnats against her 70,000,000-mile tall body. The mothership opens a large porthole, and a beam cannon rises from it, starting to charge up...
15222211122221221121211111.title: The rumbling is worse than ever--she's abou...

choices: 50,000 light years--she's half the size of the Milky Way!!!
Who says she's going to stop growing at this point?
152222111222212211212111111.content:
Original author: Growasaur

The raptor is quite intelligent and kind, but she is admittedly a little confused at seeing the teeny bugs in space, no-less than by their attempts to tell her to stop growing so much or so big. If it was wrong to grow like this, why was everyone snugging up to her? Deciding she wasn't about to stop what was so nice, she opened her mouth wide, and closed it again, first to show her many, many enormous teeth, and then, the snort out through her nostrils, blasting half the armada back comically; incensed, the mothership rallies the spiraling pawn-ships back towards formation with its magnetic field emission; opening more laser portholes to answer the gigantically vast female's insult.

With a feral "hmmph" of sorts, the raptor turns her head away, only to feel a sudden sting, as thousands of little beams let loose on her cheek and neck; they really don't seem to do much, until the mothership's main cannon hums ominously, the tip of the cannon heating up, before a far larger, wider blast is loosed, the beam so big it actually slams into the female reptile, knocking her immeasurably huge body back a relative inch. Emboldened that their technology can move even such a fantastically godlike creature back at all, they continue blasting away at her; further down on her body, and free of the ray's contact, you and the other giga-animals all stare in shock and concern, hoping this isn't the end of your biggest friend...

Within ten seconds, you already know it's not even the end, but the beginning--the beginning of something HUGE. The raptor groans and roars like a monster, the sounds all defying the laws of space all the more than before, and as you see her impossibly big muzzle stay closed, you gulp, realizing that her spurt is about to be so big that those roars are just her BODY getting ready to burst bigger. And burst she does, as the aliens begin to back away, putting their vessels in panicked reverse, as the raptor bellows and swells all over, bulging so, so big that her chest alone rushes out to greet the armada, slamming into and pummeling nearly all of the minor ones, pilots all beaming back home before they suffer for the damage she causes just by floating there and exploding bigger, and bigger, and bigger, and BIGGER, AND BIIIGGGERRR!

80,000,000 miles suddenly seems laughable; she might as well have stayed big as a mere building or skyscraper back
on Earth; with the first spurt she boomed out to over 5 times that size, then with a happy growl she expanded out to 8 times that new amount, which then swelled uncontrollably out to 12 times that new size, stacking the growth in such a stupefying manner that you and the others have to hold on tight to stay on her, which still makes her 40,000,000,000-mile body grow all the larger, showing no signs of slowing down whatsoever; her jaws hang open as she huffs happily, her tongue lolling out adorably; with her huffing, she pulls in the entire remainder of the poor little armada, the commanders and leader at the helm panicking, and firing the laser again and again to try getting away, all as she clamps her jaws over them and a good chunk of the galaxy; gulping them down unharmed as they keep firing.

In another few seconds, she begins to tingle so much that the faraway Sun begins to wiggle around fearfully, as the raptor hugs herself in joy, awash in inside-growth-beams, her toes curling as she b-b-b..b-b-BELLLOOOOWS, roaring out into the heavens, exploding to her very first light-year in size, then 5 light years...14 ly...25ly...60ly...110ly!!!

Billions of billions of miles flood into her body per second as she snuggles her own growing mass quite gleefully; it just felt so good! SO GOOD! She grows and grows with exponential force, until she's expanded to way, way over...
152222111222212211212111111.title: They fire at the raptor, and...

152222111222212211212111112.content:
Original author: Infinity421

You watch as the beam cannon begins to draw in light from its surroundings, forming a small yellow vortex, before slamming backwards and firing an incandescent beam at the 80,000,000 mile tall raptor. Just as it is about to reach her, you see a massive, dark shape suddenly intercept the beam, and begin to grow exponentially.

Who took the shot for the raptor?
152222111222212211212111112.title: They fire, but the eagle/giraffe takes the hit ...

choices: They fire at will, the poor devils...
Two other big animals take the hits, this time just to join in on the fun!
1522221112222122112121111121.content:
Original author: Growasaur

In a flash of feathers, the eagle lunges its colossal body in front of the far, FAR more colossally huge raptor, the aliens' beam hitting it dead-center in the chest; with a physics-defying, space-filling screech, the massive avian absorbs the entire onslaught, falling limp into the raptor's gargantuan hands. She looks down, arching her reptilian eyes in concern, and puts her head closer to the eagle to hear for signs of life. You, the giga-orca and giraffe all wait far, far down below on her lap, looking neck-breakingly far up at the sad sight.

Then it happens.

The ratpor's muzzle gets fluffed by a growing mound of feathers, all tingling and bristling and wobbling eerily; the eagle's beak opens, and she chirps weakly, before shuddering hard, squawking louder, and shuddering even harder, then letting loose piercing CAW as she rumbles and bursts hugely up in size, closing her eyes and racing bigger in the raptor's loving grip; the wings and feet and tail all pour out of the reptile's arms, growing longer and larger and wider, still, as her body pumps fantastically in mass! In moments she's half the size of the raptor, then three-fourths, then just as big!

Ecstatic, the raptor hugs her friend sweetly, making the eagle cry out and DECTUPLE furiously in size, growing and growing and growing, now nearly one billion miles in size, remaining teeny planetoids and moons beginning to orbit her obediently, only for most to get stuck in her feathers here and there. The sheer wall of her growing body crashes into the ship, dashing it apart in a fantastic spray of explosions and construct--though really, it isn't even half of a blip to the eagle, who bends her head down and stroke-strokes her chin over the head of the now-finally-smaller raptor, though the affection is beginning to soak into her as well, and she begins swelling gorgeously against her avian pal...

But wait--there's no time for that! A ship about the size of the raptor's entire head beams into their area, loosing thousands of smaller, gnat-like ships--an armada! The loss of one ship has brought the entire army here, and they, unaware of how the last ship was dispatched, begin to ready all their lasers at once, aiming right for the bird of lizard that are starting to fill the galaxy...
1522221112222122112121111121.title: The eagle

choices: The eagle and raptor...start SPEAKING to you! :O
15222211122221221121211111211.content:
Original author: TheCrimsonFreak

"Here we go again." It's all you can think of saying as the new armada of alien ships opens fire. It's cliche, but nothing else seems to fit this insanity. You almost feel sorry for the aliens; poor saps have no idea what they're in for.

Almost. They WERE trying to blow up your newest friends, after all.

Once more, white-hot beams of plasma erupt from the alien fleet towards the Brogdinagian-scale eagle and raptor like a swarm of shooting stars. The alien flagship (the only one that DOESN'T seem less than a speck in comparison) cuts loose with an incredible volume of fire, the starship firing so many beams that you and the other giga-critters have to look away from the lights!

As for the galaxy-filling dinosaur and her equally big avian friend? They simply share a look...and smile devilshly. How the eagle manages to smirk with a beak, you don't know...

Just before the salvo of lasers strikes, the two creatures start nuzzling, the eagle wrapping her wings around the raptor in an adorable hug. The raptor gives a playful roar as the fleet's attack hits her first, kicking off another round of cosmic growth! The dinosaur magnifies exponentially, going beyond her billions of miles in size into light years in scale! Comets smash into ice cubes against her scaly hide, and one unlucky star even goes supernova as her planet-sized tail smashes into it! All the while, she lets out a playful hiss...that actually sounds like she's laughing!

And a few seconds later, the eagle is struck...and this time, there's no sign of pain or fear about the avian, as she too balloons toward an equal scale with the raptor. As she grows, a few more nearby asteroids enter orbit around the astral-scale avian. A nebula is even swept away by physics-defying wind produced by her giddy wingbeats.

When their growth tapers off, both creatures are at the scale of GODS, easily SEVERAL DOZEN lightyears each. The eagle's wingspan has to be half the length of the Milky Way's spiral arms, if not equal size!

As for the unfortunate aliens? Well, they were now facing not one, but TWO impossibly huge foes, who only got bigger when fired on, AND were now looming over their insignificant fleet like a pair of mischievous goddesses. (Which, in a loose sense, they were.) And they were both wearing devilish grins of cosmic size.

And the raptor's mouth was open, showing every one of her planet-sized fangs.

Needless to say, the alien ships beat a hasty retreat, reversing course and speeding away towards a destination known as "The Heck Out Of Here!"
Not that it was of any use, that is.

Cutting loose with a playful CAW, the eagle flies out in front of the fleeing aliens and cuts off their line of retreat. The ships at the head of the formation crash helplessly into a feathery wall, exploding like little firecrackers against her bulk; their debris getting tangled in her feathers.

The next ships attempt evasive maneuvers, but find themselves literally blown off-course as she flaps her wings-once, twice, three times-creating a physics-defying gust that sends her unfortunate foes carreening off into the void...or crashing into each other.

That leaves the massive flagship--once as big as the raptor's head, now barely bigger than a gumball for her--and its escorts. The eagle lowers her head, looking like she's going to ram the aliens...
But a sudden roar from the raptor stops her. Snapping your gaze towards the dinosaur, you see her smirk, then swing her tail. Looking back to the eagle, you see the avian mimic her comrade's grin.

With a burst of speed, the eagle charges the remaining alien ships head-on, closing the distance of several million miles in two seconds. Before the aliens can react, she pivots in mid-flight and snatches the flagship in her talons, then chucks it towards the raptor! The smaller ships are also sent that way, by way of another wing-flap.

You break out in a cheer as the alien ships fly uncontolably towards the waiting raptor. With a smirk and--you can't believe it--a wink at the eagle, she raises her tail and SWATS the alien ships tossed towards her, like tennis balls, back towards the eagle...

Who waits with her beak wide open!

You can't help but cheer yet again, this time joined by the orca and giraffe, as the last alien ships fly right into the eagle's maw. The bird snaps her beak closed, gulping the ships down like candy! She rubs her stomach with a wing, clearly liking the snack.

A massive, star-shaking roar bellows from the raptor, soon accompanied by an equally thunderous eagle-cry as both cosmically immense critters celebrate getting rid of the attackers!

Today was especially important since it was the 3rd anniversary of the inseparable duo being childhood best friends.

8-year-old Jacob of course had a full day planned with his best friend Ben, and the two spent the morning and afternoon going to the arcade, eating at a nice restaurant along with his parents, and then going to see the new animated film at the theater.

The little--well, the young pterodactyl, specifically, it's now bigger than you are--rests there, blinking; half of it bulges free of the cave opening, its giant dino-rump wiggling a little against the rocky constraint around its midsection. The front half, stuck in the cavern with you, takes up your entire view; the parental drive is so overwhelming that you find you're already nuzzling up and down on the big tyke's lengthy beak, eliciting a soft but happy coo from the pterodactyl. It's not so bad, really--it is awfully cute, and you kind of like the idea of your child being the biggest of the big! Seems fitting!

And speaking of 'fitting', the cavern won't do much longer, as due to your nuzzling, a ripply quaking begins deep inside the young'n, getting stronger and stronger, as it closes its big eyes and chirps loudly, before lowering its head against yours and bwhoooping bigger and bigger, every shuddery breath seeming to pump the beastie larger still! The cavern opening creaks and whines as its edges begin crackling, then crumbling away in clustered chunks; outside, other dinosaurs begin to crowd around the billowing behind, as it bulges up and up, then pussshes firmly out and out, a tiny reptilian tail waggling in joy overhead; they step further and further away, as soon as they gathered, gaping and wide-eyed at the massively growing, 70-foot, ballooning pterodactyl.

It grows and grows, its long snout rubbing against your entire body, as the growth spurts force the baby dino deeper into the cave, and thus, into you; but wait, you realize the tingling is getting even worse! Does its contact with you still count? The cave relents, as a single jagged fissure forms from the top of the entrance, crackling up and up and up along the mountainside housing it, until, with a furiously loud groan and crumbling sound, the baby dinosaur inflates too big to hold, bashing up and out of the rock facade as it simply sits upright, its head shaking as it blinks and takes in the surroundings, sitting down at over 110 feet tall, many times even your huge size! You don't really know how to feel: are you embarrassed at being this much smaller...or is it even more thrilling to be in charge of such a stupendous hatchling?

As you ponder, you hear a loud growl from its belly--it just hatched and all, surely it must be hungry...
1552112111112.title: It grows so large it forces the cave open!

choices: Ack, its own belly-rubbing still counts, and it grows even larger!
15521121111122.content:
Original author: Growasaur

The rumbling spikes and lowers, up and down, reverberating inside the gigantic baby pterodactyl's grown belly; you can't really tell if the "little" guy is hungry or about to grow, so you creep towards it, steadying yourself in case it swell even larger again--so far, so good; the pterodactyl chirps loudly, blinking down at you curiously as you advance. It smiles, more than happy to have you near, as you put your head right up against its belly, gently as you can manage, for a carnivore.

You listen as the rumbling grows worse, a sudden nervous pang racing through you; your gut tells you to back up, but your feet are already sliding back and away on their own! It's his belly, you realize, which balloons out wider and wider, along with the rest of its body--it's growing again!! You gulp and skid back over the turf, as you stare up to see the pterodactyl's smiling beak rise higher and higher up into the air, the baby flapping its wings giddily, clicking its beak as it swells up another 30 feet! Could even that light touch have been countable as a nuzzling, like earlier!?

The giant bends down and scoops your huge self up with some relative ease, giving you a long squeeze as it caws and rubs its smooth beak against your neck and head, as you feel its hide tingling more and more--oh, this is bad! Very bad! You wiggle around uselessly, feeling its arms surge bigger against you, the beak lengthening out longer and thicker as the baby shudders and hiccups 40 feet taller, in one hot, rude spurt, then lurching up another 60 after that! Higher and higher the infant dino surges and shivers, the treetops all crackling as its sheer increasing girth pushes them back dominantly.

You finally slip free, sliding far down its stomach, and tumbling clumsily to a roll onto the ground; shaking the impact and embarrassment off, you look up to see the 250-foot colossus, ten times your own proud size, and only minutes old! It dips back down to nuzzle you again, nowhere near done with its first display of a child's affection, when you put out both arms to signal for it to hold on and stay put. You growl, but in a caring way, as it were, motioning for it to sit still and behave, like a good kid. You've no idea what to do next, any contact could grow the kid even more enormous!

The tyke rubs its own belly as it growls, and this time you're certain it's a matter of food--you think--probably!
15521121111122.title: Get closer, to put oyur head against its stomac...

155211211111222.content:
Original author: Infinity421

The colossal pterodactyl's stomach growls again, and it rubs it, meaning it was most likely hungry. The pterodactyl quickly begins to shiver, and you begin to step away as it bulges larger and larger, up to three hundreds feet tall. The pterodactyl seems to realise that rubbing its own belly made it grow, and begins to rub its belly more and more, shivering and vibrating, causing the surrounding area to quake.

You gulp, as the pterodactyl begins to grow again. Jus how big does the gigantic infant grow?
155211211111222.title: Ack, its own belly-rubbing still counts, and it...

choices: The Pterodactyl keeps growing and growing! Best vicious cycle ever!
The Pterodactyl seems to finally stop, attempting to fly!
1552112111112222.content:
Original author: Growasaur

It rubs and rubs, chirping away more and more loudly, as the vibrations emanating from its quaking belly get worse and worse. You panic completely, not even sure which direction to run away to; before you can figure that far, however, the baby clutches you from far up above, lifting you up, and rubbing your big self over its much bigger body!

The quaking you so feared just seconds ago has swelled to a roar, rippling up the belly and through the pterodactyl's throat, as he unleashes a juvenile, but crashingly booming caw, and blows up another 100 whopping feet, on the spot! His sides roll out greedily, crashing through nearby trees and upturning entire boulders with seemingly no effort nor notice; any dinosaurs that had stayed near enough to sate their curiosity paid for it, as the winged infant hiccups even larger, fitfully swelling and surging to over 500 feet high, then 700! The rolling girth plows clear over even the largest of herbivores and carnivores alike, not so much harming them as trapping them under uncontainable, growing bulk.

The infant chirps again and again, wildly amused, it's thick hide rumbling even more--oh, no! On top of rubbing you to itself, all the caught dinos underbulk are wriggling and rubbing against it, trying to all get free! You gulp, feeling your feet spread apart as they rest on the pterodactyl's belly, the hide stretcccchhhiiing lowly and parting your toes as your haunches splay out more and more, the baby erupting rudely to over 900 feet, then 1, 450feet!! The canopy of the jungles and bases of tall volcanoes meet you as you rise up higher and higher with the infant, the baby flapping its colossal little wings in jubilation; its beak alone completely towers over you, seeming to pull further apart via perspective as its head grows and grows.

Its belly and legs spread out and part more and more of the valley below, catching more dinos underneath its growing weight, the baby giggling as they wriggle uselessly, tickling and rubbing it more and more and more, its body doubling in one rumbling burst, then doubling that again, the beak hanging open as the baby chuffs and huffs, lost in joy, at over a mile in height! When will he stop!?
1552112111112222.title: It grows, A LOT.

choices: The pterodactyl grows into a gigantic adult!
15521121111122222.content:
Original author: Growasaur

Something up above--well, above itself, that is--catches the young pterodactyl's fancy, as the tyke sets you down on the sloping curvature of its own belly, craning its huge head up towards the clouds: other pterodactyls are in flight, swooping and soaring even higher than your little one sits. It caws gently, instinctively flapping its monstrously huge wings, kicking up small gales all over down below as it tries to mimic what it watches; you suddenly are forced to hang on tight to its thick neck scales as it gets the hang of things, and amazingly manages to start flapping enough to get some lift going; it takes to what's left of the sky it isn't filling up, and forces reality to further bend to its whims as it gets higher and higher!

Not built for flight, you panic and hang on tight as you can, the infant cooing some poorly-laid comforts as it pushes itself higher still, actually gaining quite a distance from the ground, even with its fantastic body weight; higher and higher it gets, other pterodactyls going berserk at the sight of a mile-tall family cousin flapping around them, its wind shears caused by its flight sending the other pterodactyls into an uncontrolled tailspin; irritated, several others peck at the infant's head; being such a colossus, the baby isn't at all close to hurt, but the surprise causes it to lose its concentration, and with that gone, the gargantuan tyke is now the one who begins to sputter out in mid-air! You close your eyes as it swivels this way and that, then comes crashing to the earth below!

With a cataclysmic THUD the giant baby dino lands, lifting rock, tree and dino alike on impact, like a scaly meteor, dragging its body along ten miles' worth of terrain, before coming to a halt. You wobble around on its neck, dizzy and bewildered, trying to get your bearings, as the infant shakes its massive head, blinks, and chirps to see where you are; clearly it's still not at all hurt--you feel relief, in spite of the insanity, and grin, though your relief is cut off as the infant starts shaking so bad that you can see the rest of the peninsula quaking with it--oh...OH NO! The landing!

The entire landing rubbed the pterodactyl hard, for miles!!!
15521121111122222.title: The Pterodactyl seems to finally stop, attempti...

choices: The pterodactyl talk to the t rex
155211211111222221.content: The pterodactyl grow grows bigger and bigger as its brain grown he grows to 2000 feett then he grows incredibly fast to 15000 feet as he grows up as his brain macros as the tree waches in a deep voice the pterodactyl says hi mom.
155211211111222221.title: The pterodactyl grows into a gigantic adult!
